Without being the greatest laptop ever seen, Asus gets points for trying something new in ScreenPad. Hopefully it sticks with it.
Fusion 11 may not be as slick as Parallels Desktop, but enterprise users will appreciate its integration with VMware's wider technology portfolio.
A superb 6-inch OLED screen and Android 9 are the highlights of this flagship-class handset, although it's matched by less expensive rivals.
There are lighter laptops with smaller displays, but the 14-inch Swift 7 strikes a good balance between screen size and (ultra) portability.
There is nothing not to like in the KNote 5 tablet which could certainly become my daily workhorse without any issues.
Samsung has taken its excellent smartphone expertise and expanded it to a larger tablet form factor with many of the same enterprise elements; S Pen functionality, DeX integration, and Knox.
Apple's iPhone XS Max is as big as it gets.
Motorola's latest smartphone has a lot of futuristic hype to live up to.
The 5.99-inch Redmi 5 Plus looks, feels and performs like a much more expensive smartphone. It's not perfect, but the drawbacks are minor.
For the price, Dell's OptiPlex 5260 is hard to fault if you need a compact and reliable workhorse PC for your office.
The P9000 Max from Poptel is a pared-down Android OS in a rugged phone with a large screen.
Microsoft has promised a change in the way we treat PCs and phones. Your Phone is the first step on the journey, but is it good enough?
The X380 Yoga combines typical ThinkPad features with a 360-degree screen, keyboard lock-out in tablet modes and a bundled stylus.
Dell's 14-inch Latitude 7490 is a robust business laptop with good battery life and strong all-round performance. It's tough enough to travel well, if a little on the heavy side.

Some will say that the Note 9 doesn't offer much over the Note 8, but those who use their phones to get work done with greatly appreciate the massive 4,000 mAh battery, Bluetooth S Pen, stunning display, virtually unlimited storage options, and more.
Few laptops combine heavyweight performance and lightweight design as effectively as the 2018 15-inch MacBook Pro, especially while offering all-day battery life.

Samsung's been making smartwatches for years and the hardware of the Galaxy Watch is its best yet. The software still lacks key features such as a good voice assistant and mapping, but activity tracking and watch faces are plentiful.
I road-tested the Thinkware F200 dash cam with its GPS add-on -- and loved its alert announcements and parking recording feature
Nokia's 1996 curved slider phone has been reimagined as a 4G dual-SIM feature phone with a 2.45-inch colour screen and impressive battery life.
The SDW 5016 is a solid wireless DECT headset that connects to PCs, desk phones and mobile phones.
Nokia's otherwise solidly specified 5.5-inch flagship smartphone is let down by its curved 16:9 aspect-ratio screen.
This 14-inch laptop has a touch screen, a great keyboard and good battery life, and is light enough to cater for mobile professionals.
A good performing notebook for the mobile worker and a nice addition to your tech collection.
This is a well made 14-inch laptop with some high-end components, including above-average speakers
The Honor 10 is an excellent mid-range handset with plenty of flagship-class features, including a Kirin 970 chipset, 128GB of internal storage, and AI-assisted cameras.
Amazon's latest streaming box is a balanced mixture of its most popular hardware products.
A portable wi-fi router with built-in VPN that can also charge your smartphone should be an attractive proposition for mobile professionals. But the devil is in the user experience detail.
This 6-inch mini-PC lets you put Windows 10 in your pocket, but short battery life and touchscreen-only operation limit its on-the-go functionality.
The Stylistic Q738 is not overly expensive, but it will probably have to function as your only computer, so you'll need to be able to live with its tablet-first architecture.
The F70 from Thinkware is just the device for people who hate cluttered windshields but want a high-performing dash cam.
This combination of smart speaker, 360-degree camera, smartphone-class processor and robotics firmware delivers a superior experience for remote meeting participants.

product name: Garmin Fenix 5X Plus Sapphire (black with black band)
product description: The Garmin Fenix series is designed for those who participate in more than just running and cycling and if you enjoy tracking every detail of your outdoor adventures then it is a watch to consider. The long battery life makes it something you can wear and never worry about, which appeals to me more than today's advanced smart watches.

product name: HP Envy x2 mobile PC: A mixed bag but a worthwhile travel companion
product description: ZDNet takes the HP Envy x2 around Japan to find out whether the Always Connected PC could become a replacement for your laptop on the road.
The 2018 13-inch MacBook Pro delivers strong CPU performance and good battery life, which help to justify its premium price tag. We'd still like to see a discrete GPU option though.
The dual-band, three-pack variant of Linksys's Velop mesh wi-fi system is straightforward to set up and performs well.

The Jabra Elite Active 65t earbuds provide an excellent wireless earbud experience with long battery life, comfortable design, and a smartphone companion app that adds enhanced functionality. The voice assistant support is top notch and lets you get things done with hands free to work.
The Lifebook T938 is a solid 13.3-inch convertible with a twisting rather than rotating screen hinge, and a good selection of ports, including legacy connectors.
FileMaker continues its move from database tool to low-code mobile app authoring system and simplifies the number of versions available.
The 2018 ThinkPad X1 Tablet is compact and durable, offering a bundled stylus, all-day battery life and optional mobile broadband.
New tools to speed up complex tasks that used to take a lot of fiddly work make the latest CorelDRAW a boon for productivity.
The KEY2 will appeal most to BlackBerry fans who want to continue using a keyboard-equipped handset. For others, giving up today's larger screens might be too much of an ask.
Sony's idea of a Bluetooth headset that allows the outside world in is good in theory, but falls over in practice.
PDF 2.0 support, real-time collaboration and e-signatures are among the features that will streamline your PDF-based workflows.
The Kasmer tracker has a full-colour screen and looks nice on my wrist. But this nice-looking fitness tracker does not have the functionality I want.
The 2018 ThinkPad X1 Carbon remains the business laptop to beat, offering a tough chassis, an excellent keyboard and all-day battery life for all but the most demanding power users.
The ZenFone 5 is unremarkable in terms of design and hardware specs, but includes a range of AI-related features that lift it above the ordinary.

The Elephone U Pro has a fantastic 6-inch screen, a large battery, voluminous and expandable storage, and good looks. But there are one or two rough edges and the main camera performance is disappointing.
Mobvoi is innovating on a smartwatch platform that's standing still.
It carries a premium price tag, but the ultraportable ZenBook 13 UX331UN delivers the goods bar one or two minor drawbacks.
The ThinkCentre M910z is neither sleek nor super-fast, but it's a thoroughly capable office PC that provides strong performance for a variety of tasks at a highly competitive price.
The ThinkPad T480s is a well-made 14-inch business laptop with very good battery life, a useful sliding webcam cover and plenty of configuration options.
The Hi9 Air from Chuwi is a nice, sleek tablet that runs multiple apps together well, and its 10.1 inch-screen is great for gaming.

product name: Samsung Galaxy Tab Active 2 - tablet - Android 7.1 (Nougat) - 16 GB - 8"
product description: The iPad may set the bar for tablets, but it's not setup for field work. Samsung has taken its excellent smartphone expertise and expanded it to a ruggedized tablet that is sized and specced for work in the elements.
The third outing for Lenovo's 360-degree ThinkPad X1 convertible is excellent in almost every way except for battery life, which could be better.
This compact 13.3-inch laptop delivers top-notch specifications and build quality, plus excellent portability.
HTC's newest phone is gorgeous to look at and captures great photos, but the new haptic buttons, poor battery life, and annoying indicators may bug you too much to commit $800 to the experience.

If you have a very limited budget for a phone, yet want a big screen experience with good battery life and dual cameras then the Alcatel 3V may be a good purchase. It's a slow performer though so make sure to bring along some patience.
LG has been releasing some solid Android phones, but it just doesn't get much respect in the market. Launching the LG G7 at $100 more than last year's LG G6 doesn't help.
The Flip is a straightforward and accessible collaboration screen without too much complexity in either the functionality or the user experience.
I wanted to see if the iLife V8s could handle the day to day cleaning of a small to medium office. Here's what I found.
The S50 from Doogee has all the robustness you need from a rugged phone -- without the clunky look and feel.
The aural parts of the XPS 15 2-in-1 detract from its impressive visuals.
It's not flawless, but considering what you get for the price, the OnePlus 6 is a bargain.
The rechargeable battery and microphone make this a useful digital pen for a wide range of Windows devices, although it's better suited to business users than artists.
The Dell 86 is a versatile 86-inch display for collaboration and brainstorming sessions, but the price matches its dimensions.
The P20 Pro is a superb handset, with its triple rear camera setup a clear highlight. Performance and battery life are excellent too, while the drawbacks -- except for one -- are minor.
The Meizu M6 Note spans both the consumer and corporate world -- and sits well in both.

Huawei's new P20 smartphone brings dual rear Leica branded cameras, the latest version of Android, and a massive screen-to-body ratio with a small notch our of the display. It's a great evolution of the P10 and likely to be one of the best smartphones of 2018.
Sony's Xperia XZ2 has a new look, plus appealing 4K and super slo-mo video modes. But it's laden with third-party apps and battery life could be better.
Remember the 1997 Psion Series 5? Now a UK startup has updated the concept and delivered a dual-boot device with 21st century connectivity.
The ZBook x2 G4 is a premium device with a price tag to match. If you're looking for a workstation-class detachable with excellent pen input, it's your best choice right now.
Reolink's second-generation Argus security camera adds colour night vision, a rechargeable battery, weatherproofing skins, and the promise of cloud storage.
This handy online project planning, to-do list and task management tool gets offline apps but not full OS integration.
The Voyager 6200 UC is a business-class Bluetooth neckband headset with integrated earbuds that struggles to justify its price tag.
The Moto G6 Plus offers a capable CPU, an impressive dual rear camera system and high-quality industrial design, although battery life could be better and the fingerprint sensor is awkwardly located.
We take a look at Samsung's current flagship smartphone after an extended amount of time.
I was wowed with the F800 Pro dash cam from Thinkware within minutes of using it.
The X30-E updates last year's model with 8th-generation Core processors and more storage capacity, but the lid is still too flexible.

As a runner who is motivated by music, I have been waiting for the day when Garmin would release a GPS sports watch with offline music support. After the initial music setup, the experience is great and the watch is fantastic for tracking runs, sleep, and daily activity.
The compact Lifebook P728 delivers all-day battery life, while PalmSecure biometric security plus smart card and mobile broadband options make for a capable, if pricey, system.

Given the world we live in, it is important to be careful when opening up your door to strangers. The Nest Hello provides an optimal doorbell and security camera experience for those visiting your front door.
This affordable 5-inch Android smartphone offers decent build quality and impressive battery life, but the CPU/RAM combination is underpowered and it's short on internal storage.

The Huawei MateBook X Pro is a well designed laptop with an excellent fingerprint scanner, massive display in a minimal body, high quality quad speakers, and solid daily performance. The keyboard and webcam are a bit compromised.
This dual-socket AMD EPYC-powered system offers a total of 64 cores and 128 threads, giving it an advantage over comparable Xeon-based alternatives for many types of workload.
Huawei makes excellent hardware and its EMUI software has improved over the years. However, Google hasn't spent much time optimizing Android tablets and it still shows on solid hardware.
Outside of the Apple Watch for iOS users, the Fitbit Versa is the smartwatch to beat right now. It's comfortable, stylish, and has excellent battery life.
The Neato Botvac D7 Connected is a fully functional robot vacuum that can be controlled and customized right from your phone. It may be the best of the current generation.
The Precision AIO 5720's high-end graphics performance makes it well suited to tasks such as photography, design and illustration work. It's also competitively priced.

The new Samsung Gear IconX lasts through my longest runs, never moves around in any weather condition, provides solid sound and volume, and has some advanced features for those looking for more than just a Bluetooth headset.

The Garmin Speak Plus is the first dash camera I have tested, and I loved the ability to capture video and photos without touching my phone. Navigation through voice and the awesome OLED display was an excellent experience, too.
The 2018 version of Dell's excellent 13-inch ultraportable impresses in almost every way, except for the awkward placement of its camera.

product name: HP EliteOne 1000 G1 - all-in-one - Core i5 7500 3.4 GHz - 8 GB - 256 GB - LED 34" - French Canadian
product description: In regular business scenarios, the HP EliteOne 1000 will comfortably handle most workloads, but it should be capable of so much more.
The Aermoo M1 is a solid waterproof phone to cope with the rough and tumble of outdoor life.
The Honor 9 Lite sets a new high bar for the £200 price point, making it the affordable Android handset to beat.
This solid typewriter-inspired keyboard is a pleasure to use as well as a joy to look at. Steampunk enthusiasts will love it.
Google's dedicated Clips camera was designed for families to capture special moments without watching it through a screen.
Huawei's P Smart and the Honor 9 Lite are very similar handsets, but the latter costs less and has a better front camera.
The Gear Fit 2 Pro is an impressive wearable device, but it's hardly a major departure from the previous, more affordable, model.
This large, high-resolution display provides clear, sharp images along with a basic HDR capability.
Apple's first foray into smart speaker market has the sound and looks, but does it have the smarts?
The M6 dash cam is simple to install and operate - but it does have its limitations if you need to record what is following you.
The Chuwi SurBook Mini packs a performance punch for its compact size -- and is a joy to use.
HTC has come up with a very good handset in the U11+, but it's far from the best value for money available.

product name: CAT S41 - 4G LTE - 32 GB - GSM - smartphone
product description: Protective cases on all glass smartphones can't match the protection of a smartphone built for field work. The CAT S41 is tough and its 5,000 mAh battery has it going for days.
Top-end models can get expensive, but this sturdy laptop offers long battery life and an excellent choice of configurations, although Intel's latest Core processors are not on offer yet.
A smart speaker that's large and in charge.
The Jumper EZpad 6 Plus delivers good performance and has some nice design features for a Microsoft Surface clone.

product name: Moto Smart Speaker with Amazon Alexa
product description: With some refinement, this Moto Z Mod could work quite well. But it could also use a price cut.

If you're prepared to spend some time anglicising your machine, the Mi Notebook Pro offers excellent value for money. But is it worth the risk of buying from China and forgoing any after-sales support?
Densify is a capable and affordable cloud optimisation service, suitable for any company struggling to get to grips with its expenditure on public cloud services.
If you want the latest silicon, a ton of memory, and fast storage at a reasonable price, this Asus 2-in-1 deserves a second look.
The SJ7 Star is a well-built compact camera that is more than a match for a GoPro, but it's around half the cost.
I road tested both Z-Edge Z3 Plus and S3 Stealth dashcams on a recent road trip, and liked what I saw.
The Yoga 920 builds on the excellence of the 910, resulting in an impressive 2-in-1 with only minor drawbacks.
The Maze Alpha is an affordable, bezel-less 6GB phone with a large 6-inch screen.
Want to keep your home or office warm more cheaply this winter? Netatmo's remote control thermostatic valves let you take control of every room to reduce your heating bill.
This new Windows Phone is an affordable handset for business users who want to stick with Microsoft's mobile OS.
Want to protect the data you carry around? Check out iStorage's encrypted SSD and USB thumb drives with PIN pad access.

At just $200, it's tough not to recommend the Honor 7X for first-time smartphone owners, younger customers, and those looking to get 90 percent of the functionality of a high end flagship for a fifth of the cost.
Stride's real promise is in its prospective integration with the rest of Atlassian's portfolio.

The Samsung Gear Sport offers a high end stainless steel smartwatch with a user interface optimized for the wrist. It supports activity tracking with the capability for customized healthcare solutions while also offering business app support.
Its design and build quality are nothing special, but this 15.6-inch laptop offers plenty of configuration options plus a good selection of ports and slots.

HP's 14-inch ZBook 14u G4 is sturdily built, relatively thin and light, and provides plenty of connections and configuration options. However, we were disappointed with the performance from this entry-level mobile workstation.
Google's 5-inch Pixel 2 offers understated design, a pure Android 8 experience and an excellent rear camera. Battery life may be a worry for power users though.
Google's first foray into wireless earbuds isn't off to a good start.

The ZTE Axon M is an AT&T exclusive and there are some use cases for the dual screen setup. It is well built and responsive, but it a thick phone and you need to figure out a practical use case for the dual screen setup.
The Loupedeck is a photo editing console for Adobe Lightroom -- but is it worth the investment?
Intelligent productivity features and great battery life are the standout features of this mid-range, touchscreen-only 5.5-inch smartphone.
The OnePlus 5 was an outstanding handset back in June, and the new 5T model is even better, at the same price. We can only find minor criticisms of this superb-value smartphone.
If you want to watch movies or see your images on a larger screen, the DBPower LED projector is a low cost option you could try.
The Amazon Cloud Cam isn't just for Amazon's new delivery service, Key. The Cloud Cam is more affordable than most high-end indoor security cameras and gets the job done just as well.
The Mgcool Band 3 is a low cost fitness band that tracks basic activity functions -- but the app needs a lot of work.
If you live in the Microsoft world, the way many businesses use Cortana makes the Invoke potentially as handy around the office as at home.
For the money, Xiaomi's Mi Mix 2 is a stunning smartphone. It looks fantastic and performs well, and you'll have a phone that none of your friends or colleagues have.

product name: Samsung CHG9 Series C49HG90DMN - LED monitor - curved - 49"
product description: Samsung released a 49 inch curved monitor focused on gamers last year and is now marketing it as a productivity powerhouse. It mostly lives up to the claims, but suffers a bit in resolution.
If you are looking for an affordable action camera and the GoPro is out of your budget, then try the DBPower 4K.
The Meizu M6 is the latest offering in Meizu's M range -- and it is a pleasure to use and hold.
It might resemble an expensive Chromecast, but Airtame is more like a wireless HDMI cable with enterprise management options.
Google's newest Chromebook is an impressive tool for business users and consumers alike.
This 'smartpad' solution sounds good on (digital) paper, but the implementation could be better.
The Alcatel Idol 5 is a great phone for $200 with standard 3.5mm and USB Type-C ports, NFC, and attractive design with the option for a basic VR experience.
As more smartphones ditch the 3.5mm headphone jack, wireless earbuds are getting a boost.
Visio Online is useful, but at this stage it's clearly a companion for the desktop software. Power users will want to stick with the full-featured Windows version.
Amazon kicked off the smart speaker craze nearly three years ago. Does the second-generation Echo have what it takes to push it forward?
Lenovo's IdeaPad 720S is not exactly lightweight, but it's solidly built, while the keyboard and discrete graphics are standout features.
Chuwi's Lapbook Air  is slim and lovely, and it looks like a laptop costing twice as much.
The Toughbook CF-XZ6 is a sturdy 12-inch 'business rugged' detachable laptop, but it's an expensive device that's not without drawbacks.
Face ID, an impressive display, new interaction methods, and solid performance put the iPhone X on top.
The Beats Studio3 Wireless headphones combine tried and true design with Apple's W1 chip for an impressive experience.
There's little truly remarkable about the Nokia 8, but it delivers a flagship spec and excellent battery life at a competitive price.
The Pixel 2 XL has an improved camera, new design, and new software tricks.
The 2017 Amazon Kindle Oasis provides you with a worry-free premium reading and listening experience. It's the best ebook reader available and is priced for those who love to devour books.
The Star 9 fitness band has all the basic functions to record your health activities, but it is not engaging -- nor very accurate.
The Orbi Pro may be more expensive than conventional wi-fi routers, but it offers small businesses a flexible plug-and-play networking solution.
It's seriously expensive, but Apple has finally released an iMac that can handle VR and other high-end content-creation tasks.

Solidly built, well specified and very configurable, Dell's 2017 XPS 15 should suit the demanding business user. It can get expensive, though, and the minimal-bezel screen makes for an awkward camera position.
The 15.6-inch VivoBook S15 offers a Core i7 CPU and a discrete GPU in a compact chassis, but some trade-offs have been made to achieve its competitive price point.
The S60 will not win any slim-line phone beauty parades but its waterproofing functionality and rugged good looks makes it a durable winner.
The Elephone S8 is a tri-bezel-less phone with a huge screen and a gorgeous glass back that is great for consumers and business users.
The new Fire TV just shows you don't need to spend a lot on a fully capable and integrated 4K streaming device.

The V30 is easily the best phone ever made by LG with the large minimal bezel display, high quality dual rear cameras, Quad DAC audio support, microSD card, drop/water/dust resistant construction, and attractive design.
The Doogee BL5000 is a pretty phone that at under $200 will not break the bank.
The Essential Phone was a tough sell at $699, but at $499 it is compelling. It offers flagship specs with lots of potential, but there is some risk in a startup launching its first phone.
This robust 12.5-inch 2-in-1 detachable offers an adequate spec, a good selection of ports, and plenty of optional accessories, including 4G LTE.

The Fitbit Ionic brings integrated GPS, onboard storage for music playback, smart notifications, wearable payment support, and an application platform in a very attractive and comfortable form factor with a battery life of up to four days.
A solid and stable release, High Sierra offers compatibility with older Macs going back to 2010 and should prove a straightforward and worthwhile upgrade for most users.
The Mgcool Explorer 1S 4K action camera is a tiny, lightweight, low-cost alternative to the GoPro, and it does the job rather well.
The Destek V4 VR headset brings you a superb VR experience with good quality hardware at a really low price.
This 13.3-inch ultraportable has a 360-degree rotating screen, is slim but solidly built, and delivers a good combination of price and performance.
Apple's mobile OS signals a clear shift in emphasis towards greater productivity on the iPad, as well as flagging up the company's ambitions in augmented reality and home automation.
The Chuwi SurBook is an affordable, high-performing alternative to the Microsoft Surface and the Apple iPad Pro.
If meeting space is tight, and your IT budget somewhat less so, Logitech's MeetUp conference camera fits the bill for meetings with 6-8 participants.
This 360-degree add-on Mod for Motorola's Z-series smartphones is fun to use, but has some limitations.

The Moto G5S is an affordable dual rear camera phone and while the output isn't perfect, it is fun to get creative with the depth enabled mode. The rest of the phone has all of the great Moto software enhancements with a fairly stock Android experience.
The Doogee BL7000 is an affordable, solid smartphone with a great camera and an extra long battery life.
Apple's iPhone 8 Plus boasts some fancy new camera tricks that make it attractive... for now.

product name: ECOVACS Deebot R95 - vacuum cleaner - robotic
product description: The Ecovacs Deebot R95 is the most affordable high end robotic vacuum that gives you full control over your cleaning experience while also making sure the job is done well.
Meizu has outdone itself with its latest phones. The Pro 7 and Pro 7 Plus have some very cool new features.
Panasonic has delivered a robust 12-inch hybrid laptop/tablet that's best in its fully-rugged class right now.
Garmin's Fenix 5 is a bulky smartwatch that majors on sports and activity tracking. It's packed with features, but expensive.
The Ulefone T1 is a sleek-looking, fast, and affordable device with several nice-to-have extras in the box.
The latest version of Corel's classic natural media painting application adds more tools for professional artists, but also makes it easier for new users to get to grips with the software.
The Fritz!Box 7590's ease of use places it at or near the top of the list of broadband routers for anyone seeking a fully-featured home/small office networking device.

product name: Samsung Galaxy Note8 - SM-N950U - midnight black - 4G LTE - 64 GB - GSM - smartphone
product description: The Note 8 gets the job done, and does it exceptionally well. A smaller battery is frustrating but should be enough to get through most days. Note fans, you're going to love this phone.
Asus has packed a 14-inch screen into a compact, solidly built yet lightweight chassis, although the display's moderate resolution and lack of touch support will be an issue for some.

The ZenFone AR offers a unique augmented reality experience as the technology begins to mature. The phone feels great with the leather back, looks fabulous with the high resolution Super AMOLED screen, and has the internal specs needed to power it for all business use.
A combination of solid build quality, strong battery life and a 14-inch display makes Acer's Chromebook 14 excellent value for money.
This mouse with a pen-like attachment aims to deliver an ergonomic cursor-navigation experience.
The updated ZenBook Pro should appeal to business users requiring a fast, powerful laptop that can act as a desktop-replacement system both in the office and on the road.
Apple's newest smartwatch is smarter in that it's always connected, but is it worth the cost?
Toshiba's sturdy yet relatively lightweight Tecra X40-D is well equipped for life on the road, although battery life could be better.
Flexible upgrade options and rugged build make this little tablet appropriate for a range of field service and other vertical markets requiring solid performance and good reliability.

The Moto Z2 Force Edition is a competitive Android smartphone that offers a stock Android experience with useful Moto enhancements. There are better phones out there though if you don't ever plan to use a Moto Mod.
Buy an external Thunderbolt 3 expansion box and a powerful graphics card to put in it, and you can give your Mac's (or PC's) GPU performance a serious boost.
With its PageWide technology this inkjet-powered MFP is blindingly quick, cheaper to run than a laser, and more reliable.
The Lima Ultra is geared towards consumers who need a file access and backup system, regardless of which device or OS they are using. But is the device worth the investment?
Shopping for an Android device on a tight budget? This phone will do the job, but just barely.
The Honor 9 joins a growing roster of competitively priced flagship-class handsets, delivering good performance and battery life, a decent 5.15-inch screen, and an impressive dual camera setup.

This thin client offers an acceptable Windows 10 experience and is well suited to schools, colleges, and small businesses seeking an affordable and easy way of rolling out centrally-managed Windows desktops.

The Snoppa M1 is a three-axis stabiliser for smartphones that uses drone-style technology to deliver professional-looking steadycam video recordings. That's the theory: how did our initial hands-on testing go?
The ZenBook Flip S offers a light, slimline convertible design that, along with good specs and performance, will appeal to mobile professionals. Battery life could be better, though.
Dell's Chromebook 13 3380 is no lightweight, lacks a fully rotating screen and has a somewhat unforgiving keyboard, but it delivers good battery life and is solidly built.
The latest version of Parallels' Mac-based virtualisation software is now optimised for macOS High Sierra and Windows 10 Fall Creators Update.
The Nokia 5 is a well-designed mid-range handset with excellent build quality, although several compromises have been made to achieve its attractive price point.
Motorola's latest smartphone is affordable -- and it's expandable with Moto Mods.

product name: HP Colour LaserJet Managed MFP E77830
product description: A Samsung-derived engine turns this A3 LaserJet into a fast and very capable multifunction printer/copier with lots of new security features to keep would-be printer-hackers at bay.
Meizu has released its latest M-series affordable phone -- aimed at capturing the international mobile user base
As well as temperature and humidity, Foobot tracks things like particulate matter and volatile organic compounds, building up a detailed picture of indoor air quality.
This versatile and reasonably-priced IP65-rated camera is suitable for small businesses as well as homes.

Back in 2013, many wished Nokia had gone with Android to survive without the Microsoft takeover. Nokia-branded smartphones are back and the Nokia 6 gives us a glimpse of the greatness to come from HMD Global.
The Doogee Mix Android 7.0 phone maximizes screen size in a compact body and delivers loads of performance.
With a Snapdragon 835 chipset, a 4K-capable screen and a 19-megapixel main camera with a super-slow-motion mode, the Xperia XZ Premium has a lot going for it. But there are significant downsides too.
This premium-priced business thin-and-light laptop offers all-day battery life and plenty of ports, but build quality, especially in the lid, could be more robust.
Amazon added a screen and a camera to the Echo -- and it's awesome.

product name: AirBar touchscreen sensor for MacBook Air
product description: ZDNet reviews the AirBar, a touchscreen gadget with the potential to transform your Apple experience.

product name: Apple MacBook Pro with Touch Bar (15-inch, 2017)
product description: The 2017 15-inch MacBook Pro boosts both processor and graphics performance without affecting battery life, but remains expensive.
Nokia's entry-level Android 7 phone looks good and includes NFC, but falls short on processing power and screen resolution.
Dell's 12.3-inch 2-in-1 is well built and offers plenty of configuration options, but we'd prefer it if the keyboard was bundled.
Lighter and more compact than its predecessor, the Toughbook CF-54 offers a solid, up-to-date choice for professionals requiring a well-protected laptop for field service work.
First Look: Don't call it Surface Pro 5. The latest iteration of the Surface Pro loses the model number, keeps the kickstand, and adds mostly subtle refinements.

product name: Apple MacBook Pro with Touch Bar (13-inch, 2017)
product description: Intel's Kaby Lake CPU provides a welcome speed bump, but the price is high and there's no discrete GPU option.
This slim Chromebook is no entry-level device, offering a solid metal chassis, a 360-degree hinge for its 12.5-inch touchscreen and a high-quality backlit keyboard.
Is the Surface Laptop a vehicle for a new era of Windows 10 S, or a good laptop that has an operating system installed that no one wants?

The Huawei MateBook X is a stylish, elegant laptop that is designed and built to go anywhere. It will survive spills, unlock quickly with your thumb, blow you away with audio, and let you work on a large display without distractions.
Apple's venerable database adds new layout and programming tools to make building desktop and mobile apps more powerful, but still approachable.
Some iMac owners may be tempted to wait for the forthcoming iMac Pro, but this 2017 update proves that the veteran iMac is still alive and kicking.
The X3Plus from Teclast looks and feels like a Microsoft Surface Pro clone -- with more RAM than the basic model and at a much cheaper price too.

If you spend your time working outside or in conditions where you might wrap your phone in a big, bulky rugged case, then you may want to consider the affordable LG X Venture. It is built tough and provides solid performance with the software being the only let down.

Most consumer level 360 cameras are ready for light duty conditions, but the Garmin VIRB 360 takes it to the next level with a 10 meter waterproof rating and rugged design for action in harsh environments.
It has a versatile 28-inch display, but the Surface Studio will need a serious price reduction if it's to compete with the latest high-end AIOs on the market.
This well-featured wireless router continues AVM's tradition of high-quality hardware and usable software.
It's hard to review the new iPad Pro without peering into the future and thinking of its true potential once iOS 11 is released.
There's a lot of competition among 'flagship-killer' smartphones, but despite a price rise the OnePlus 5 is arguably leader of the pack.
ZTE is known for selling inexpensive -- yet capable -- smartphones. Now, the company is trying to bring that approach to smartwatches.
There's plenty to like here, but there's no webcam or touchscreen, limited on-board connectivity and an irritating power switch location.

If you can afford it, then the Envy 34 provides a stylish and impressive home entertainment system or executive desktop PC. But its curved 34-inch screen will have to work pretty hard to justify the price tag.

The first generation Huawei Watch was a fashionable watch, but this year's model is ready for the road instead of the office. It's packed with powerful specs and takes on the Apple Watch when it comes to fitness.
The Nokia 3310 does the basics well enough and offers excellent battery life, but the price is high for a 2G phone with no wi-fi.
This smartwatch will be improved by Android Wear 2.0, but will still lack NFC, GPS and a heart-rate monitor.
The Garmin Forerunner 935 is the successor to the FR 735XT and is basically a lighter, plastic, and less expensive version of the Garmin Fenix 5 that was just released a couple of months ago.
This smart device measures humidity, noise, temperature and carbon dioxide, delivering common-sense advice via a smartphone app.

Samsung's latest Windows 10 offering is naturally compared to the Microsoft Surface Pro. One major difference is that the Galaxy Book comes with a keyboard in the box. It also has a longer battery life than the Surface Pro 4.
With an attractive display and a versatile design, the Chromebook R13 is well suited to mobile web browsing and simple document creation when you're out of the office.
This high-resolution wireless mouse could prove a real time-saver for anyone who uses more than one computer at work.
HTC set the standard in mobile for many years and with the HTC U11 everything I've wanted in an HTC phone is provided. The camera finally lives up to the hype and the price is tough to beat.
Kobo's latest e-reader offers waterproofing and automatic blue-light exposure control, but misses a trick by omitting public library lending support.
Huawei's 5.5-inch flagship smartphone offers excellent build quality, high-end specs and impressive battery life. With one or two caveats, it's highly recommended.
The Moto G range continues to deliver great value for money in the shape of this very competent mid-range five-inch Android 7.0 handset.
There are question marks over screen resolution and touch support, but Lenovo's flagship ultraportable is otherwise hard to beat.

For the price it's hard to argue with Xiaomi's flagship-class Mi 6. The usual caveats apply when buying a device that's not fully vendor-optimised for the UK market, but for less than £400 something's got to give.
Apple surprised everyone last month by releasing a revamped iPad model with a starting price of $329. We put it to the test.
It clearly has the looks, but does it deliver on the smarts?
This entry-level phone costs less than $90, and it's perfectly adequate for the casual user who loves taking photos. I am not convinced however about its use as a business device.
Lenovo's Miix 510 two-in-one hybrid has a solid kickstand, a well-made keyboard, and a bundled Active Pen stylus. Downsides include significant heat output and disappointing battery life.
The ER4XRs aren't cheap, but they offer decent bass and good sound definition. These are tiny, powerful headphones that definitely deliver.
Nostalgia aside, the BlackBerry KEYone is a smartphone with a physical keyboard done right.
The Windows 10 version of CorelDRAW has one feature that could transform vector graphics, along with many helpful improvements, while subscription pricing makes the update much more palatable.
Without an HP Workspace subscription, the Lap Dock is simply a dumb screen-extending device for the Elite x3 -- albeit a well-built one that offers a 1,920-by-1,080 viewing area.
ShareFile combines many of the advantages of cloud storage, FTP and internal document repositories, and is well suited to businesses that need to consolidate different storage options.
This experimental minimal email search tool from Microsoft is useful, but it's more likely to turn into a feature than an actual product.
Toshiba's latest flagship ultrabook offers light weight, convertible laptop/tablet functionality, 7th-generation Intel Core processors and all-day battery life, but it's not without drawbacks.
Acer's 14-inch Swift 5 is competent and attractively priced, and will make a good travelling laptop for business users who don't want to pay premium ultrabook prices.
Like Apple's iMac, the Dell XPS 27 has now evolved from an attractively designed home PC into a professional-level graphics workstation.

There are plenty of choices in the Android world for less than $300 and the Moto G5 Plus may be the best. The standby screen, useful gestures, long battery life, and water resistant nano coating make it very difficult to justify paying two to three times this amount for a flagship.
Samsung's Galaxy Tab S3 is an Android tablet done right.

Microsoft's new 'Slack competitor' has improved dramatically since the preview, and new features are arriving regularly. Where it shines is threaded chat, easy video meetings and superb integration with other Office 365 tools.
Xplore's 12.5-inch Windows tablet is rugged, well designed and offers plenty of configuration options. Fan noise and battery life are potential issues with the Core i7 model though.

Other than last year's LG G5 modular mishap, LG has been improving its G series with each release. The LG G6 is its best yet and competes with the other flagships at a lower price in a form factor fit for business.

product name: HTC U Ultra sapphire blue - 4G LTE, LTE Advanced - 64 GB - GSM - smartphone
product description: The HTC U Ultra is a departure from the unibody metal HTC designs of the past and HTC has succeeded in making glass gorgeous. Unfortunately, it's one of the largest phones available with a limited capacity battery.
The Poof pet activity tracker will track your pet's activities and could help you find your lost pet - if you have an army of Poof users living nearby.
The Transformer 3 Pro's high-quality chassis design and bundled keyboard and stylus are offset by poor battery life, which may be a deal breaker for many potential buyers.
This wireless presentation tool goes beyond laser pointing to deliver navigation and content interaction features designed to boost your confidence when facing an audience.
The Yoga 910 offers a superb screen, excellent industrial design and all-day battery life, but you'll pay handsomely for a top-end spec.

It's not your everyday data centre platform but, if parallel processing of HPC workloads is your game, then Intel's second-generation Xeon Phi processors fitted inside this Boston Quattro server are the way to go.

At just $288, the Alcatel Idol 4S is a solid piece of hardware and does well at running Windows 10. There are some minor performance issues with Bluetooth and the fingerprint scanner, but if you like the Live Tile interface then it's one of the best available to hold you over until a possible Microsoft Surface phone.
Dell's XPS 13 gets 360-degree screen rotation and a few specification tweaks, bringing extra flexibility to an already impressive ultraportable.
The Meizu Pro 6 Plus Android smartphone gives you all the capabilities, performance, and quality you would expect from a top-notch business smartphone.
Wileyfox's 5.2-inch Swift 2 X is a good-value mid-range handset. Photography fans might want to steer clear, and anyone concerned about the Cyanogen issue should do their research before buying.
LG and Google teamed up to create the LG Watch Sport, one of the first devices to run Android Wear 2.0.
If you want to have the flexibility of a tablet with the functionality of a laptop, then the Chuwi Hi13 will fit the bill rather nicely.
While critics are crying Apple is lacking true innovation, AirPods are a sign the company still has the "Apple" touch.
Going wire free shouldn't cost you a fortune, and the latest from IFROGZ is a perfect example of that.
This modular wireless security camera system is affordable and easy to configure, but needs some refinement to be really compelling.
A couple weeks of using Snap's Spectacles has me excited for their potential.
The new task-oriented user interface in Lightworks 14.0 is a long needed overhaul that makes this powerful cross-platform NLE a real pleasure to use.

At a whopping 5.9 inches, Huawei's latest combines the big screen and big battery of the Mate 8 with the fantastic dual-lens Leica camera of the P9. At just $599.99, it is a compelling offering priced much lower than models released outside the US.
Version 12 of TeamViewer retains its simplicity and ease of use, adding the ability to do remote control among Android, iOS and Windows 10 Mobile devices, among other embellishments.
​A year after it was first announced, Samsung has released its Gear S app for iPhone users.
Booting to the Windows 10 OS takes 15 seconds, booting to Android takes 30 seconds.
The ability to display two A4 pages side by side, 1,920 by 1,200 resolution with flicker-free backlight and high energy efficiency make the 240B7Q well suited to business use.
This well-built, lightweight ultraportable looks fantastic but is also expensive and comes up short in places, notably screen resolution and battery life.
Using the OnePlus 3T for an extended review period has been a pleasure. If you're looking at flagship smartphones from the leading vendors, you'd do well to consider more affordable OnePlus 3T too.
This is a well-thought-out rugged handset with a high-quality screen, good ergonomics and a feature set that should help mobile workers in a variety of vertical markets get their jobs done.
The 2016 Dell XPS 13 is a superb ultraportable laptop. Powerful, light and well-made, it's available in a range of standard configurations, each of which can be further customised.

LeEco is trying to break into the US smartphone market, but it's coming on too strong with software and services that offer questionable value. The hardware is fantastic, but there are other compelling Android smartphones at this price point offering a more stock Android experience.
Gyration's presenter-friendly Air Mouse range adds voice commands to its impressive feature set.
Lenovo's ultraportable laptop for budget-strapped students and business users is only a partial success, the biggest drawback being its disappointing screen.

The 2016 15-inch MacBook Pro delivers professional-level performance in an attractive, lightweight design that also offers all-day battery life. However, it's extravagantly expensive, and the lack of upgradeability is a real weakness.
This is a competent Cyanogen OS-based handset at a good price, but Wileyfox is up against some big names in a competitive market.
It might look like an iMac wannabe, but the ASUS Zen AIO Pro delivers excellent value for money. Choose your spec carefully though, as there's limited scope for upgrades and repairs.

The Samsung Gear S3 Frontier is better than the Apple Watch in most areas and will soon even work with an iPhone to compete against the Apple Watch. However, you can't ask it for your favorite team score or easily control it with your voice while some advertised apps are still missing a month after release. It is a complete package in an extremely high quality piece of hardware and it may be the best smartwatch ever over time.
HP's Z1 Workstation G3 won't win any accolades for its looks, but it's a very capable workstation-class all-in-one desktop with a good level of access to the internals for servicing and upgrades.
Dell's OptiPlex 7440 is a businesslike desktop PC designed for mainstream office workloads, with straightforward user upgrades and repair options that should appeal to IT managers.
Clever design and versatile features make the IdeaCentre AIO 910 an attractive and competitively priced option for anyone needing a large screen all-in-one desktop PC.

With its docking options and Windows 10 Mobile's Continuum functionality, HP's Elite x3 aims to provide all the computing that some mobile professionals require. It won't be for every organisation though.
You may not think you need a voice-activated speaker and a cloud-powered digital assistant in your home, but Amazon's Echo and Alexa may persuade you otherwise.
Automatic Pro streamlines the process for tracking your driving -- or the driving of your employees.
We like this 13.3-inch system's build quality, screen, keyboard and audio subsystem, but its battery life may fall short of a full day's work.

ASUS has made some sensible trade-offs with this affordable 10-inch Android tablet: the plastic case is sturdy, the moderate screen resolution doesn't cause any serious problems, and battery life is adequate.
The LG V20 will be shipping to customers this week. This is one of the few remaining smartphones with a removable battery and it's the king of customized media creation.
Lenovo shows impressive ambition with the Yoga Book, revamping the tablet format to combine a virtual keyboard and a drawing surface. The hardware design is superb, and battery life is good too.

Moto figured out a solid approach to modular smartphones and the Moto Z offers a good base on which to build. If Lenovo would step up and continue the timely updates Motorola was known for then this would be an excellent Google Pixel competitor.
Google's answer to the Amazon Echo isn't perfect, but it's the best in its class.
The Touch Bar-free 13-inch MacBook Pro is an attractively designed laptop that could find a niche as a 'MacBook Air Pro' upgrade, but recent price rises may prove hard for UK buyers to swallow.
Similar to Lenovo's approach with its Moto phones, BlackBerry provides a pure Google experience with productivity and security enhancements that make it the best value flagship available today.
vSpace Pro addresses the pain points of complex and costly hypervisor-based VDI with a much simpler yet still effective alternative that shares desktops on just one Windows OS.
Designed for photo and video editing, the ViewSonic VP2468 is built around a full-HD AH-IPS panel and WLED backlight, delivering very creditable managed colour performance at a reasonable price.
A look at Google's first Daydream VR headset and phone, which combine to create an immersive, intuitive experience.

A capable small-format business 2-in-1, the cost of the Latitude 11 5000 Series can mount when the optional keyboard and security features are taken into account. It's on the heavy side, too, and a high-resolution screen option would be useful.
Google's push into becoming a hardware company by creating its own smartphone is off to a fantastic start.
GPS tracking and heart-rate monitoring, alongside step counting, should give the Spark 3 sports watch wide appeal. More battery life in GPS mode would be welcome, though.
The new entry-level Kindle should deliver a perfectly acceptable e-reading experience, but it has a lower-resolution screen than more expensive models, and lacks a backlight.
The iPhone 7 begs the question: Is Apple pushing the smartphone forward, or only doing enough to get by? I think it's a little bit of both.
Nuance's Dragon Professional Individual v15 improves on what was already a great speech recognition product, but audio transcription is still a work in progress.
Samsung's truly wireless earbuds do more than blast music, pulling double-duty as a fitness tracker from inside your ear.
After learning to live with the struggles of the first Apple Watch for far too long, the Apple Watch Series 2 puts Apple's wearable ambitions on track.
Water resistance is a welcome addition, battery life continues to impress, and the simple camera interface just does its job without worry. The iPhone 7 Plus is the best iPhone, as it should be.

product name: Ultimate Ears' Party Mode for UE Boom, UE Boom 2, and UE Megaboom
product description: Have more than one UE Boom-series portable Bluetooth speaker? You're going to love the newest feature.

A couple of manufacturers have released Android Wear smartwatches with GPS, but it took a GPS sport watch maker to finally get it right. If you run, hike, or bike and want a single watch that does it all then the Polar M600 may be the one for you.
Pebble 2 adds a heart rate sensor to a refined smartwatch, but little more.
This feature-packed and accessible PDF editor could prove a worthwhile investment for small organisations that currently get by with free PDF tools.

Parallels Desktop 12 doesn't have the eye-catching features of last year's edition, but improved performance, time-saving options, and regular updates should help to maintain its lead over virtualization rivals such as VMWare Fusion.
A visual planning tool that fits in between personal task management and full project management, Planner has a nice approach to the basics but needs more powerful features to really shine.
Battery life could be better, but Acer's Switch Alpha 12 is still very good value for money, delivering good performance and a high-quality display.
Huawei is bringing its first Kirin-powered smartphone to the US under the Honor brand. It's a fantastic smartphone available for just $399.
It's pricey and on the bulky side, and battery life could be better, but the Voyager 5200 UC is still a high-quality Bluetooth headset with some smart features.

ProCompetition is heating up with compelling Chinese smartphone designs coming in at $400. However, if you are willing to pay for the best, nothing beats the Samsung Galaxy Note 7 and you won't find a better smartphone available today.
ASUS has come up with a lightweight convertible laptop here, which has a lot going for it. But try the screen and test the keyboard before buying to make sure they meet your requirements.
Kobo's Aura ONE is a functional and waterproof 7.8-inch e-reader with good font management and screen backlighting. However, its jarring screen refresh system could use some attention.
This robust and well-protected 10.1-inch Android tablet is suitable for use in a variety of working environments, including hazardous ones.
Immune to dust, rain, and hard knocks, Getac's S410 is designed for an adventurous outdoor life.
Need to create professional-looking social media content using just an Android or iOS smartphone? Microsoft's experimental app may be what you're looking for.
This 5.5-inch Android phablet delivers good value for money, but should you risk a device from a little-known Chinese manufacturer?
If you are considering a new Android tablet that excels in responsiveness and does not break the budget then try the Onda V96 Remix.
This low-cost handset from UK start-up Wileyfox looks good, but it lacks performance and storage capacity.
Apple's annual desktop OS update brings a new name, while the arrival of Siri signals increasing integration between Macs and iOS devices.
This elegant Core M-based ultraportable offers excellent industrial design and military-grade durability, but the 4K touchscreen model comes up short on battery life.
It's not designed for a hardcord athlete, but Samsung's latest Gear Fit 2 brings both music and GPS tracking together in a light weight band form factor.

Dell's Inspiron 17 7000 2-in-1 is the first 17-inch laptop with a 360-degree screen hinge that we've seen. The combination of such a large screen and a form factor more commonly associated with ultraportable devices is intriguing, if not entirely successful.

This summer's update to the applications in Adobe's Creative Cloud subscription brings character animation in After Effects, more content-aware tools in Photoshop, improved Adobe Stock integration and more.

HP has taken inspiration from Microsoft's Surface Pro 4 in the design of its Elite X2 1012, which is very solidly built for such a slim and light device. The price is competitive, but battery life needs to improve.

The Moto Z Force Droid shows how a modular phone can work without compromising on the design of the core phone. The current Moto Mods may not be that compelling to everyone, but it's fairly inexpensive to customize the back and the potential is there for useful mods.
An unusual but charming attempt to bring some style to the budget end of the smartphone market.
Toshiba's Portégé Z20t-C is a well-specified 12.5-inch Core M-based laptop/tablet hybrid with good battery life. It's not without drawbacks, though, and the price is high.

The Stylistic R726 is a solid business-focused tablet/laptop hybrid with LTE support and a cradle-style dock. Battery life could be better, though, and there are potential issues with the magnetic keyboard attachment and screen reflectivity.
Signing digital documents and PDF versions of paper forms is easier with Adobe's new Sign tools, which include Acrobat support and more integration with Box and OneDrive.
If you can live with limited internal storage, screen quality and processing power, Acer's cloud-focused Windows 10 laptop looks like a bargain.

product name: ZUS Smart car finder and USB car charger

product description: This fully rugged 10.1-inch 2-in-1 tablet/laptop hybrid offers a good set of features and accessories, and delivers decent performance and battery life -- at a hefty price.

Lenovo's 12-inch Yoga 900s offers good battery life, 360-degree screen rotation and sub-1kg weight that makes tablet mode operation a practical choice. But there are irritations too -- notably the keyboard, which is a bit too light-touch for our taste.

Lenovo's 12-inch ThinkPad X1 Tablet is a compact and robust modular 2-in-1 hybrid. It's not cheap though, and you'll probably have to add the optional Productivity Module to get reliable all-day battery life.

The Flir One thermal imaging add-on for iOS and Android devices is a very desirable peice of tech. Whether it's a justifiable expense is questionable, although if you maintain or repair electronic equipment it could cut diagnostic times drastically in some cases.
The Kindle Oasis looks good and works well, but lacks the show-stopping features it really ought to offer considering its premium price.
Anyone looking for a new Android handset off-contract should consider the OnePlus 3: it's quite simply the best handset in its price range right now.

product name: Foscam C1 Lite HD Wireless Camera: Good hardware, poor control
product description: This indoor camera could be great for monitoring the interior of your home. But is it worth the effort?

This oversized Windows tablet is aimed at design and engineering teams requiring a transportable A3-format viewing platform with content editing capability. Performance and battery life are underwhelming, though, and it's expensive.
It is a great buy for the road warrior who needs performance and practicality in a low cost, light device. My Microsoft Surface can stay in the drawer for now.
Dell's compact but sturdy Latitude 13 7370 offers good battery life, an excellent edge-to-edge FHD screen, optional mobile broadband, and even a high-res touchscreen option if you can afford it.
The cameras are better than anything we've seen on HTC devices before, and nothing else matches the fit and finish of the HTC 10.
Despite its innovative dual-lens camera system, the P9 doesn't threaten today's leading flagship smartphones. However, it wouldn't take much to turn the P-series into a genuine challenger.
The MacBook's lightweight design is hard to beat for portability, but there are alternatives that offer better battery life and more connectivity for office use.

The Philips BDM3490UC is a stylish curved ultrawide display with good image quality, good connectivity and Picture-in-Picture capability. As with all current curved displays, the curve is more style than substance, but the sheer expanse of screen is impressive.

Dell's slimmed-down Precision 15-5510 delivers the power you need for professional-level design work, even if its modest battery life means that it's still essentially an office-bound desktop replacement system.
Six months ago, I decided to replace my desktop PC with a Surface Pro 4 and a Surface Dock. After a few frustrating months, I think this might work out.
The second version of this pocketable PC offers desktop Windows on the go, with an expanded set of ports on the new Dock Pro.
To complement its completely wireless, battery-powered Arlo cameras, Netgear has launched an HD networked security camera that adds more features, but needs a power connection.
ASUS has designed the Vivobook E200HA to meet a very challenging price point, and has made a fair stab at the task. Just make sure you can live with its shortcomings.

Canonical has been promising desktop-mobile convergence for Ubuntu since 2013, but BQ's Aquaris M10 Ubuntu Edition still seems like a work in progress. As a result, interest in this tablet is likely to be restricted to Ubuntu fans and determined early adopters.
A charger cable that also backs up and restores your phone, MEEM is easy to use and works well. The only drawback is a relatively steep price.
This 11.6-inch Chromebook delivers decent performance for its class, but lags the competition in terms of screen quality and the selection of ports and slots.
Interesting design ideas, solid construction and a high-end specification make Microsoft's first hybrid laptop an intriguing option at the more expensive end of the market.
Looking for a smartphone under $400? This 32GB Nexus 5X competitor is worth a look.

product name: HP ZBook Studio G3 Mobile Workstation
product description: HP's quad-core mobile workstation combines computing power with elegant looks, but don't expect it to last long on battery power.
After all these years are there still tools Corel can add to its graphics software suite?

HP's Pro Tablet 608 G1 is a compact and well-built Windows tablet with a high-resolution 7.9-inch screen. The entry-level price is on the high side; adding memory, storage, mobile broadband and a docking station will quickly boost that price.

We appreciate the Transformer Book T100HA's industrial design, and it's nice to see a USB-C port on the tablet section. The downsides include significant flex in the keyboard, limited internal storage and a relatively low-resolution screen.
A smaller version of the 4.7-inch iPhone 6s, the 4-inch iPhone SE is hardly a low-cost model, but it should make an attractive option for people who prefer a truly pocket-sized smartphone.

This 15.6-inch laptop has impressive internals, but cost-cutting is evident in the chassis materials, screen image quality and bouncy keyboard. Improvements in these areas would make the X555UA a far more attractive proposition.
The convertible Yoga 500 is affordable and has a good keyboard, plenty of storage and on-board Ethernet. However, the display resolution isn't great and some might require longer battery life.

This powerful 6-inch Android 6.0 phablet is well made, looks good and has impressive battery life. The drawbacks are relatively minor, but plentiful enough to give many potential buyers pause for thought.

product name: Chuwi Vi8 plus 8 inch Windows 10 tablet

product description: The ThinkPad Yoga 260 is a compact, thoughtfully designed and sturdily built convertible laptop. There are only minor drawbacks, none of which should seriously affect its appeal to mobile professionals.
An interface overhaul and faster operation make version 11 of TeamViewer even more usable.
The Tower 3000 Series is an affordable yet capable addition to Dell's Precision lineup and a very welcome one for workstation buyers on a budget.
After owning both the first Surface Pro and the Surface Pro 3, I never thought I would consider any other device for my home office. Dell has shown me that there are other viable alternatives.
Thalmic Labs claims the Myo armband can let you take control of your devices hands-free, but whether it will one day replace our mouse or touchpad remains to be seen.

product name: ZAGG Slim Book for iPad Pro
product description: Like the earlier model for the iPad Air 2, the ZAGG Slim Book for the iPad Pro is a great keyboard case.
If Chrome OS can satisfy your mobile productivity requirements, Acer's multi-mode Chromebook R11 is a well-built and affordable vehicle.

The 4K display might be something of a luxury for business users who simply want to run Microsoft Office, but the latest top-end 21.5-inch iMac will be an attractive option for users who need a fast and versatile desktop computer.
Despite its moderate battery life, the OnePlus X delivers excellent value for money -- if you can secure an invite to buy one.
Lenovo's 10cm-long PC-on-a-stick is eminently portable, but is it any more convenient than a laptop for business travellers?
Although Apple is merely catching up with the rest of the PC industry with this late entry, few hybrid PCs combine style and substance in such an attractive fashion.

The Yoga 900 retains the best elements of last year's Core M-based Yoga 3 Pro, including the unique watchband-style hinge, but boosts the CPU power with 6th-generation Core i7 and i5 processors. Battery life could still be an issue for some, though.
Dell's upgraded XPS 13 is a stylish thin-and-light laptop for business users who need to run Microsoft Office and other productivity apps all day long.
Lenovo's 2015 ThinkPad 10 is a versatile Atom x7-based Windows tablet. But a fully business-ready configuration will cost you the equivalent of a fully-fledged laptop-replacement system.
This portable USB/Bluetooth-connected device will scan, OCR, read aloud and translate text.

Huawei's flagship Mate S excels in terms of physical design, and the extra fingerprint sensor functions are welcome. We like much of the EMUI Android skin too, but the knuckle gestures seem unnecessary.
Good design and a once-a-month recharge cycle set the Vector Watch apart from other wearables, but is it enough to ditch your analogue wristwear?
The Satellite Radius 15 has a flexible-mode 15.6-inch screen that will be too reflective for many potential buyers. Moderate battery life doesn't help either, although the keyboard is excellent.

If you are looking for an excellent mid-range device that you can count on for future Android updates, then the Google Nexus 5X is definitely one of the best. The 32GB internal storage may be an issue for power users, but then again power users should pick up the bigger Nexus 6P.
This tank-like tablet has a durable design, allowing it to withstand some of the toughest climates.
ASUS has made a good job of this Atom-based 8-inch Android tablet, although fewer bundled apps that can't be removed would be preferable.
Despite Apple's reputation for high prices, the 27-inch iMac with 5K Retina Display is an attractive all-in-one desktop for video-editing and graphics work.
This charger shines light into the ear to help the brain and body "respond to changes in light and darkness." The science geek in me wanted to test this out on myself.

The Nexus 6P is an awesome device and earns a near perfect 10. It has great specifications, provides you with the latest version of Android and the promise of first updates in the future, and is priced less than other flagship phones.

HTC made some unusual moves with the HTC One A9, but the mid-level processor and small capacity battery turned out to be non-issues. However, the $500 price may just be too high when compared to other Android smartphones available today.
The fourth generation Apple TV feels like the start of something big. But right now there's so much terribly wrong with Apple's latest set-top box, it's hard to know where to begin.
Buy it if you want a well-built Chromebook for all-day use, but spend the extra money for at least 4GB of memory, if not a faster processor.
The Yoga Tab 3 Pro is a well-made Android tablet with an integrated pico-projector, good battery life, a mobile broadband option and a high-quality 10.1-inch screen.
Its premium design and construction is well worth the price.
The Inateck two port rapid car charger charges from the cigarette lighter in the car. It has one 3-foot long cable permanently attached to the charger with a lightening adapter for Apple devices.

product name: Woopower five port USB wall charger

product description: The second Ubuntu phone to reach the market, following the BQ Aquaris E4.5, is more powerful and has a larger display. The Linux smartphone OS is still a work in progress though.

Dictation and transcription is now faster and more accurate than ever with Nuance's latest speech-to-text application, which you can also use to replace typing in a range of activities on your Windows PC.

product name: Aukey 10000 mAh Quick charge external battery
product description: A handy charger for anyone that wants to charge two devices at the same time.
The 2015 version of InDesign shares many of the improvements of the other Creative Cloud apps and continues its transition from DTP to all-round publishing tool.
If you're comfortable working in Google's cloud, the Chromebook Flip is a nicely designed and attractively priced 2-in-1 hybrid that delivers impressive battery life.
Most of the compromises ASUS has made to achieve an affordable price point for this 14-inch Windows laptop are acceptable, but it's short on SSD storage and the screen quality is disappointing.
Meet the latest iteration of the secure and privacy-centric Android-based smartphone.
The quest for the best mobile work system may be over. The BrydgeAir turns the iPad Air 2 into a near MacBook clone, for a price.

product name: Hands on with Roverbeats F1 Bluetooth headphones: stylish, light and loud

product description: The second smartphone from Chinese vendor OnePlus has too many missing features to be a '2016 flagship killer', but it's an impressive handset for the price.
Sway doesn't replace PowerPoint: it lets you create interactive, dynamic stories that you can use for training, newsletters, brochures, and even presentations.
Can a phone priced around $200 rival other handsets that cost four to five times more? Surprisingly, yes if that phone is the 2015 Moto G.
The iPhone 6s provides major improvements over the iPhone 6 in terms of performance, camera quality and the new 3D Touch technology. Don't bother with the 16GB option though.
Improved performance, cloud sync, new mobile tools and the first graphing updates in years make this an important new release of Illustrator.
In a crowded field, the latest from Yuneec stands out with curb appeal and features for all levels of pilot.
The GOgroove Bluetooth speaker is a water-resistant, rugged speaker with a carrying loop that makes it  perfect for adding stereo sounds to your hikes.

product name: Marsboy bone conduction headphones: Great music without loss of hearing

product description: Parallels 11 is a polished virtualisation solution that allows Mac users to switch easily between OS X and Windows apps, regardless of which operating system they were written for.
Worried about the lack of removable battery or expandable storage? Maybe you shouldn't be.
Elegant design and a high-resolution screen make the T300 Chi an attractive hybrid, but there are enough drawbacks - battery life foremost among them - to give mobile professionals pause for thought.

With a graphical interface that makes it easy to use desktop software on a mobile device and an enhanced file manager, Parallels Access 3.0 is one of the most efficient and productive remote access solutions for mobile professionals.
If you need to quickly transfer files between your PCs, then the HB4009 will seamlessly connect and simplify the process, helping you to improve your productivity.
This long-awaited upgrade realigns Office for Mac's user experience with that of its Windows and mobile-OS counterparts.
Netatmo's Welcome is a clever HD security camera with a key selling point in the form of its face recognition technology. Upcoming motion-sensing tags will deliver extra security functionality.
Logitech's first products under the new Logi brand are three protective cases for the iPad. The keyboard version turns the iPad Air 2 into a workhorse that can stand up to bumps on the road.
If you are looking for a solid, well constructed splash proof Bluetooth speaker that looks equally good in the office or outside then the MercuryBox from Inateck could be exactly what you want.
EE's 5.2-inch Harrier is a solid Android smartphone, and a good choice for someone who doesn't need the glamour (and expense) of the big-name brands.

product name: ZAGG Rugged Book - keyboard and folio case
product description: This case by veteran accessory maker ZAGG can be used in four different configurations while keeping the expensive iPad safe.
More cloudy and faster all round, the 2015 Creative Cloud version of Adobe's Photoshop offers bold ideas and useful improvements.
The Mi 4i phone from Xiaomi is a high quality build device with a solid look and feel and good performance.

Plenty of connected cameras are suitable for monitoring your home or office, but Netgear's new Arlo is completely wireless and comfortably waterproof, with infrared built in for night and dark areas. It's increasingly extensible too.
This keyboard from Ryan Seacrest's company is the best one for the iPad Air 2.
This 12-inch Android tablet offers an interesting twist in the shape of the Duet Pen, which can digitise notes you make both on-screen and on paper.
Plug-N-Play USB Video Conference Camera System
Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery and the Jide Remix Ultra is certainly flattering the Microsoft Surface tablets.
The Pebble Time is a marked improvement over the original Pebble and the Pebble Steel.
This is a Visual Studio for the world of distributed teams and continuous delivery, for cross-platform apps and for shared development environments.
This charger shines light into the ear to help the brain and body "respond to changes in light and darkness." The science geek in me wanted to test this out on myself.
The four ounce Eachine 6,000mAh charger gives you a quick charge and extra LED torch light functionality whenever you need it.
These power packs from Intocircuit certainly pack a punch when it comes to charging more than one device at the same time.

Seen too many dubious security-in-a-box solutions? USB armory is the real deal for anyone looking to protect and control their personal digital privacy and security. But is this real deal ready for regular users?

Logitech's cylindrical ConferenceCam Connect delivers high-quality HD video conferencing for groups of up to six people. Useful extras include battery-powered operation and wireless screen mirroring for compatible mobile devices.
Matthew Miller has spent nearly two weeks with the Apple Watch Sport and it has exceeded all of his expectations. It's not yet perfect, but well ahead of Android Wear.
The revamped MacBook is wonderfully slim and light, with a high-quality Retina display. However, performance and battery life are relatively modest, while wired connectivity is severely limited.
This business laptop crams two batteries in a svelte yet rugged form to make it easy to take it on the road.
A lightweight USB travel charger for all of your devices whilst on the road
The ZenBook UX305F is an impressively thin and light 13-inch Core M ultrabook with some very attractive features. The main drawback is its meagre 128GB of SSD storage.

product name: Review: Inateck universal Bluetooth keyboard BK1003E
product description: The Inateck universal Bluetooth keyboard is ultra light, ultra thin and pairs to devices like a dream.

Microsoft's relatively affordable Atom x7-powered Surface 3 can 'work like a laptop when you need it', so long as you stick to mainstream workloads and remember that a keyboard is an extra-cost option.
It's not just good for typing, it's a real writer's keyboard.
HP has gone back to basics and reinvented its consumable technology, enabling the latest generation of Colour LaserJets to run faster and cooler, and print a lot more pages for your money.
A combination of 5K resolution and strong GPU performance make the latest, more affordable, 27-inch iMac a tempting system for graphic designers and photographers.
The Android phone won't win any awards for performance, but the addition of LTE will make this entry-level smartphone a strong contender for bring-your-own-device users.

product name: Apple 15-inch MacBook Pro with Retina Display (mid-2015)
product description: The 15-inch MacBook Pro remains Apple's most powerful laptop, with an outstanding Retina display, but this modest update offers little to entice existing users to upgrade.

HP's ZBook 15 G2 is an impressive mobile workstation, with plenty of available configuration options. Battery life isn't great, but overall this is a well-built system that delivers very good performance for the price.

Some vendors would have you use calendar software and proprietary room panels to book meeting rooms and hot desks, but Smartway2 mixes the cloud with mobile apps to let you do it all from a tablet or your smartphone.

Adobe's active, pressure-sensitive Ink stylus and passive Slide ruler are nicely designed and integrate well with the Creative Cloud ecosystem. However, it's a pricey bundle, and the Ink stylus currently does not work satisfactorily with Apple's latest iPad Air.
This reworking of the ThinkStation design propels Lenovo to the top of the workstation tree with a cleverly engineered and powerful product that can handle the most demanding of applications.
The HP EliteBook product line has been serving the enterprise well for years. The Folio 1020 is a thin laptop with rugged build quality that only falls short in a few areas.

A dual-SIM 3G smartphone running Ubuntu (for Phones), the BQ Aquaris E4.5 Ubuntu Edition demonstrates that the OS can run well on a mid-range phone originally designed for Android. However, Canonical's platform is a work in (rapid) progress, rather than a fully formed mobile phone OS.

Nicely built with a superb 15.6-inch Ultra HD screen, a Core i7 processor and plenty of configuration choices, Dell's Precision M3800 mobile workstation is an excellent notebook with few serious drawbacks.
If you appreciate unique designs, prefer Android over iOS, and want the best camera available on a smartphone, then run to your local carrier store this week and pick up the Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge.
As long as you find the cloud integration useful rather than intrusive, this is a much-improved version of Acrobat with better access to its powerful tools.

The Transformer Book Flip TP550LA is a 15.6-inch multimode notebook whose Core i7 processor and reasonable price are added attractions. Bear in mind, though, that it's heavy and unwieldy (especially in tablet mode), screen resolution could be higher, and battery life isn't great.

With latest-generation Xeon processors, DDR4 RAM and a wide choice of GPUs, Dell's new Precision workstation is equipped to handle applications needing extreme processing power as well as high-end graphics. Storage options are limited, but otherwise it's an excellent and flexible workstation.

From secure containers to Docker support, to abstracted networking and storage, the most interesting features in the next version of Windows Server will come next year with a later preview and System Center beta.
This cloud-based small-business accounting service provides a well-planned set of tools for staying on top of your finances and streamlining the processes involved.

The Nexus 9 is the first tablet to run Android 5.0 (Lollipop) and offers excellent performance plus impressive sound quality. There are drawbacks, though, including some build quality issues, a tendency to run warm and a premium price.

Getac's 11.6-inch V110 is more portable than the average rugged notebook. The screen is excellent for outdoor viewing, and multiple wireless and GPS options make this a highly adaptable, if expensive, notebook.
