The Marshall Acton Bluetooth speaker brings iconic design and wireless technology to your portable sound system hardware and packs a powerful punch of sound.
A well built comfortable set of Bluetooth 4.0 foldable headphones deliver a wide sound range and long battery life for a good price.

product name: iDea Taco Dual Bluetooth 4.1 NFC Stereo speakers
product description: If you want stereo sound when you are out and about, then dual Bluetooth speakers connected to your device will give you the surround sound experience like you get at home.
I took both of these power banks on a road trip and did not need to charge my phone from AC power until I returned.
This premium-priced convertible has plenty of impressive features and excellent build quality, but the tablet lacks connectivity and must be charged via an adapter.
If you like the LG G4 and don't mind the bump in size and weight, then you will love the LG V10.
Calling this a "privacy" phone is a stretch, but it has some redeeming features. A keyboard for one, and Android for another.
This O2-exclusive handset (in the UK) combines solid build quality and good battery life with a competitive price plus good security and privacy features courtesy of Cyanogen OS.
HP's affordable Envy 4520 offers scanning, wireless and duplex printing, and printing from mobile devices.
It's not cheap, but this wireless headset delivers excellent sound, and is very comfortable to wear.
The Axon Mini is a well built and affordable Android 5.1 handset with a good set of features that should deliver all-day battery life for most users.
With the Celsius J550, Fujitsu has squeezed workstation-grade components into a quiet and compact desktop format, including a full-height GPU card for applications that really need it.

With its 4K display, Core i7 CPU and discrete GPU, the XPS 15 can handle both mainstream and more demanding workloads. And with its slimline design and elegant edge-to-edge display, the XPS 15 shows that Dell can take on Apple at its own game.
Lenovo has delivered another impressive ThinkPad X1 Carbon, albeit one that's distinctly evolutionary. Connectivity is improved, but the touchscreen option is gone and battery life could be better.

The 9.7-inch iPad Pro's enhanced display, new camera and sheer horsepower make it ideal for creative users. But it's an expensive device when kitted out with the upgrades and accessories a professional user would require.
Improved audio quality and optional extension microphones equip Logitech's latest ConferenceCam to handle large meeting rooms.
There's a lot to like about the Core M-based ZenBook UX305CA, including the price and the battery life. However, the 512GB SSD version isn't universally available.

The 5.5-inch Huawei P9 Plus is every bit as impressive as the smaller 5.2-inch P9, but with a number of key feature enhancements. The dual-lens main camera will appeal to many, but the P9 Plus has plenty more going for it.

As well as Xeon E5-2600 v4 processors, this compact dual-socket workstation gets a comprehensive overhaul with faster memory, liquid cooling, super-quick NVMe storage and a choice of Nvidia Quadro graphics cards.
BlackBerry's newest phone is a passable for its price, but its misguided effort to promote its security as something bar-raising will not stand the test of time.

A few years ago, spending $100 to $150 on an Android smartphone meant you were willing to put up with excessive lag, a poor camera, no chance of upgrades, and a user experience loaded with manufacturer and carrier bloatware. That is no longer the case with a phone like the Moto G4 Play.

The 13.3-inch ZenBook UX330UA may look like a MacBook Air clone, but a Core i7 CPU and a high-resolution display put it significantly ahead of Apple's ultraportable without any additional price premium.

If you're in the market for a large-screen phablet, this 6.44-inch handset is definitely worth considering: performance, battery life and camera quality are all up to scratch or better, and the price is very competitive.

Sony has added 5.2-inch and 4.6-inch handsets to its trio of 5-inch Xperia X models and the XA Ultra 6-inch phablet. The XZ and X Compact are capable smartphones with new camera features, but the range now seems overpopulated.
In lieu of a full review after a few days of use, here are some observations about what it is like to use Google's vision for the future of Android.
Sprint continues to improve it's network technology and the new HTC Bolt is being launched to promote its LTE Plus network with 3x20 MHz carrier aggregation.
Acer's TravelMate X349-M is an affordable 14-inch ultraportable, with specs and performance to match. It could well earn its keep if you need a basic business laptop that doesn't cost a fortune.
Devices that help you find lost items via Bluetooth already exist, but Pixie shows the potential of AR outside of gaming.
The ZenPad 3S 10's excellent design, processor and screen are offset by somewhat disappointing battery life, but it's still great value for money.
A well-priced Android smartphone with great performance, good looks, and an easy user interface.
If you are looking for a premium device at affordable price, then the stylish, well built M5s will deliver the solid performance from an Android phone you will be happy to own.
Heart rate monitoring and notifications make this stylish smartwatch more capable, but there are still some accuracy and usability issues.

product name: Philips Brilliance BDM4037UW 4K Ultra HD LCD Display with MultiView
product description: The top-end BDM4037UW is a large, curved display that, thanks to its MultiView feature, offers an alternative to multiple tiled displays.

At just $250, it's tough not to recommend the Honor 6X for first-time smartphone owners, younger customers, and those looking to get 90 percent of the functionality of a high end flagship for a third of the cost.
This well built, well specified and relatively affordable smartphone is likely to give some of 2017's premium flagship handsets a good run for their money.
With the diminutive Z2 Mini G3, HP has managed to deliver workstation-class performance in a mini-PC form factor.

The Huawei P10 brings all of the high end specs from the Mate 9 into a 5.1-inch form factor. The unique front-facing fingerprint scanner, dazzling color options, and advanced camera modes make this pocket-sized phone a joy to use.
Wireless headphones from a company known for its microphones? It's not as crazy as it sounds.
Rugged construction, dual SIM slots, and a big battery make for a tough, versatile handset.

The Jabra Elite Sport earbuds were designed to provide you with good quality music playback while working out in any environment. The truly cord-free headset means you don't have any restrictions on your movement and can stay focused on your workout.
Huawei's flagship Mate 10 Pro is bursting with features. A great screen, very good battery life and widespread use of AI make it a pleasure to use, while IP67 protection is welcome.

The Moto X4 is a solid mid-range phone that will likely let you perform 80 percent of what you want on an Android phone at less than half the cost of a flagship device. Buy an Amazon Prime Exclusive one to save yourself $70 too.
Adobe's new UX design application takes an interesting new direction, but currently lacks features.
Microsoft's newest addition to the Surface line is a 15-inch beast with surprisingly good battery life.
Best described as 'transportable' rather than 'portable', this external GPU adds extra graphics horsepower to your laptop.
This wi-fi-based camera system can withstand the rain, delivers HD video from two AA batteries for two years, and keeps you updated via a smartphone app.
A smart speaker that's not tethered to an outlet? Go on, I'm listening.
Battery life and the performance of the solid-state drive both leave room for improvement, but the Transformer Pro T304UA is still an attractive option for business travellers.

There is something of a 'back to basics' feel about Fujitsu's Lifebook U747, and that's not necessarily a bad thing. But if all-day mobile working is a must, then the U747's slightly disappointing battery life will be a concern.
The Maze Alpha X is a well-built bezel-less phone which performs very well indeed.
Huawei's budget brand delivers great features and performance, effectively rivalling its own flagship handset.
The Hi9 is a nice compact Android tablet for under $200 which will keep you connected throughout the day.
These true wireless earbuds tick a lot of boxes, although more affordable options are available.
I like the idea of wearing a smartwatch -- and the D106 has everything I could need.
Since its launch in 2016, Vivaldi has developed into a functional and configurable browser that's well suited to use on a touch-screen device.
This premium convertible laptop offers a good specification, including all-day battery life and optional mobile broadband, but its build quality could be sturdier given the price.

Samsung is the world's top smartphone manufacturer and has perfected the Android smartphone to the point where there is nothing lacking in the S9 Plus. Combined with excellent reception and solid phone performance the S9 Plus is going to be tough to beat in 2018.
The Hi9 Plus is the latest Android tablet from Chuwi which continues to improve with each model released.
Lenovo's take on Google's Home Hub comes in 8-inch and 10-inch versions, includes a camera with a privacy cover, and supports landscape or portrait orientation.
This 6.5-inch mid-range smartphone packs a decent set of features and a big battery to power them, at an attractive price.
This robust 13.3-inch hybrid offers a good range of ports, including legacy connections, on its keyboard dock plus a stylus and optional LTE broadband.
If you need a second Android smartphone, there are more usable alternatives than this diminutive offering.
BlackBerry Mobile continues to roll out phones with QWERTY keyboards. The KEY2 LE is more affordable than the KEY2 while making minor changes that don't compromise productivity.
The Vankyo Leisure 510 is a great projector with superb sound which will cope with any of your home or work presentation requirements.
This 5.7-inch Android 8.1 handset looks more expensive than its budget price would suggest, but faces stiff competition in the low-end smartphone market.
The affordable HTC U12 Life is fine as far as it goes, but there's nothing here to make it stand out from the crowd.
The Finney is a well-built Android handset, but its real job is to demonstrate the value of Sirin OS as a secure and usable platform for cryptocurrencies and other blockchain applications.

While it's not really a smartwatch, the Huawei Watch GT is a gorgeous 24/7 life tracker with GPS and advanced heart rate tracking. It lasts a couple of weeks and over 22 hours when using the GPS tracking capability.
The M8 is well made, reasonably powerful and well specified, including dual-SIM LTE support. If you need a fully connected large-screen second device, it's great value for money.

It's been 10 years since Samsung launched the first Galaxy S device and this year's model continues building upon the Galaxy Foundation with innovative tech, enhanced intelligence, and an overall solid competitor to the iPhone XS Max.
This 5.7-inch Android 8 smartphone hits an attractive price point, but there are trade-offs, notably in screen resolution and battery life.

The Polar Vantage V is an excellent multi-sport GPS watch that is made better by the Polar Flow platform and coaching provided after data is collected and analyzed. Wrist-based power is new to the watch and hopefully future updates will expand its usefulness, but there is still plenty to love right now.
Apple's AirPods have finally been updated. We take a look.
The Amarey A800 is simple to use and schedule – and is fabulous at clearing up pet hair.
Garmin has an assortment of mobile tech to aid golfers with improving their game. The latest golf watch provides you all you need in full color with a lightweight form factor and accurate tracking.
CorelDRAW comes to macOS and the web, and still adds a handful of useful new features for Windows users.
This slim-bezel ultrabook benefits from a clever screen hinge, a separate number pad and decent battery life, but the screen and keyboard could be better, while the USB 2.0 ports need upgrading.

The quartet of rear cameras on the P30 Pro delivers superb results. Although there are minor drawbacks elsewhere, this is a handset that photography enthusiasts, and even professionals, should take very seriously.
The G7 Power is all about battery life.
The Alldocube M5X is a nice compact Android tablet that looks stylish and has all you need for work and entertainment when you are out and about.
The Amazon Kindle was first introduced in 2007 and now 12 years later the most affordable model adds integrated lighting so you can read in any lighting condition.
Adding motion and door sensors is an easy decision when it comes to upgrading your home security system.

The most reliable and best performing robot vacuum I have ever tested was the Roborock S5. That title now passes to its successor, the Roborock S6, that improves in a couple of key areas along with continued smartphone app updates.
With the P30 Lite, Huawei has favoured smart industrial design and a triple camera system over screen technology and battery capacity. If you're happy with these trade-offs, it's a good buy.
The XGIMI Play is a nice little hand-held pico projector that gives a crisp sharp image if you do not want a huge display.

The Samsung Galaxy S10e may be the best new Samsung phone for the masses with a reasonable price, small size, excellent cameras, and more. The flat screen and fingerprint scanner may even make it more appealing than the high end S10 Plus.

The Garmin 935 was the premier running and triathlon watch two years ago, but its successor improves in nearly every aspect to even beat out last years Fenix sports watch models. It's the ultimate multi-sport watch and sets the bar for all others.
The Pilot Era 360 degree VR camera from Pisofttech promises to be the only camera you will need -- however you plan to use it.
Despite its somewhat dated Core M processor, Chuwi's AeroBook is a very fine 13.3-inch laptop for the money.
This is a rich and usable CMS for microsites that integrates with Salesforce, allowing you to manage customer information.
Interchangeable tips make for flexibility, but the magnetic connections make this a fiddly approach.
With 4K video support, enhanced night vision and a built-in spotlight, the Arlo Ultra is one of the most advanced and versatile security cameras currently available.

If you generally use your laptop in standalone mode, the MiniBook's diminutive screen and keyboard may leave you wishing you were using a larger device. But that didn't happen to me as often as I thought it would.
I spent a fortnight with the Bose Frames Alto and I wish I had more reasons to wear them.

My family likes to drive older vehicles so mobile tech such as Garmin's line of dashboard cameras offer important functionality. A couple of the latest Garmin cameras bound the current lineup with a tiny camera and a fully functional driver assistant.
The BV9700 Pro from Blackview is a rugged phone with some useful features and an external night vision camera.
It's small, neat, well-priced, and has some clever features, but this wi-fi mesh system doesn't match its rivals for coverage or speed.

Bike commuting can be a dangerous endeavor, but thanks to the Garmin Edge 530 and Varia tail light/radar, you can monitor approaching vehicles while tracking all of the details of your commute. The bike computer takes your training to the next level with customization and data capture too.

Samsung released its yearly Galaxy Note series update with the Note 10 and Note 10 Plus. Expected internal updates were made, along with improvements to the S Pen capability and camera functionality, but a couple things were also thrown out.

It's still early days for 5G networks, but the Mate 20 X 5G looks like a good choice of handset at the moment, despite costing £200 more than its 4G sibling -- so long as you can handle a 7.2-inch device.

product name: Dell Latitude 7400 2-in-1 - 14" - Core i5 8265U - 8 GB RAM - 256 GB SSD
product description: Fans of Dell laptops will rush to purchase this metal-encased machine.

product name: Polar Ignite - glass fiber reinforced polymer - smart watch with band - white
product description: The Polar Ignite has a sleek, slim form factor and can be comfortably worn 24/7. The proactive coaching works well at helping you improve your fitness and achieve your goals, but the display is frustrating and sleep tracking isn't as reliable as it should be with the focus on this metric.

Coros recently released its third wearable product with a focus on the adventurer who explores above 8,000 feet. However, runners and cyclists exploring the lower altitudes will still appreciate other features in this Garmin, Polar, and Suunto competitor that focuses on the essentials.

Sonos is focused first on the music experience and has proven to excel in this area. With added support for Amazon and Google voice assistants the Sonos One is the speaker to buy for outstanding audio you can control with your phone or tablet.
The ZenBook Pro Duo's full-width secondary ScreenPad Plus shows admirable commitment to innovation, but squeezing it into the chassis has consequences for ergonomics and battery life.

The Roborock series of vacuums has been reliably taking care of my chores for a couple of years, but the mopping capability was only something I used for testing. The S4 is the perfect vacuum for getting the essentials done right at a reasonable $400 price point.

The iPhone 11 Pro is simply the best smartphone that Apple has ever produced -- and every day brings new found pleasure. The camera is fantastic, Apple relented on thinness to give us more battery power, and there's no other phone quite like it.
The Orico 6239U3 hard drive dock has fast data transfer speeds and offline cloning in an attractive transparent enclosure
On paper, Google’s Pixel 4 XL looks promising.

Google Pixel phones are known for advanced camera software, but this single feature cannot carry the Pixel 4 to success. There are many other elements important to business use that are just not present on the Pixel 4.
Apple’s AirPods Pro offer everything we’ve grown to love about AirPods and a whole lot more.

The 10.1-inch Stylistic Q509 is designed for life in the field or the factory, with options including mobile broadband and a keyboard dock. But processing power and/or screen brightness could be issues for some use cases.
For your peace of mind, the Thinkware U1000 is certainly worth the cost, if you have a much-loved or valuable car.
The Langogo pocket AI translator is a handy little device that you can take with you anywhere. It is  simple to use, and fast to translate.
The Vanyo V600 is a nice reasonably priced portable projector for business and home use and bright enough to use in daylight
The BenQ EH600 projector is an impressive business projector that would not be out of place in your home theater.
The Doogee N100 is a superb, entry-level phone, which is tough enough to stand up to the knocks and bumps of everyday use. It also has a battery that will last and last.
The Precision 7740 is a highly configurable desktop replacement laptop that's well suited to demanding applications, including graphics, VR and AI.

The MagicWatch 2 covers the basics of health and fitness monitoring well, but Honor needs to work harder on its smartwatch offer. The absence of NFC and lack of support for third-party apps are the main concerns.
It's very tough and has exceptional battery life, but the Nokia 800 Tough's 2.4-inch non-touch screen compromises usability, while the 2MP camera is disappointing.
Good physical security for shared encryption keys to protect collaboration on cloud storage services may fail at the last hurdle: ensuring that employees use it.
The HD 450BT offers decent audio quality and noise cancellation, good battery life and a polished companion app at a competitive price.
The Cosmo Communicator is a big improvement on its Gemini PDA predecessor, adding a more powerful platform, a backlit keyboard and an outward-facing touch screen.
Samsung's second-generation Galaxy Buds are a respectable upgrade.

Oppo's 2020 flagship smartphone dispenses with pop-up cameras in favour of a more traditional arrangement, and packs an excellent set of features, including Qualcomm's top-end 5G chipset and best-in-class fast charging.
The Lanmodo 1080p night vision camera is not a dashcam, but it will significantly aid your night time vision when driving down dark roads at night.
Microsoft's 13-inch ultraportable should prove a capable and durable travelling companion, although it's light on ports and battery life on the Core i7 model could be better.

Some think the OnePlus 8 could have used a mid-range processor to start closer to a $500 price. However, at $699, it is the least expensive 5G phone available today with flagship specs commonly found in $1,000 phones.

While Samsung Galaxy Note 10 devices have dropped into the $600 to $730 price range, you can pick up the new Moto G Stylus for half that price. It offers simple stylus support and is a solid budget option for those who want to get work done without breaking the bank.

TCL's first entry into North America with its own brand delivers stunning design, high-end AMOLED panels, solid camera technology, and an affordable price. This impressive entry into the mid-range market will make you question ever spending $1,000 on a smartphone again.
It's not the fastest or the cheapest consumer VPN, but this privacy-first service does a good job of making advanced features like split tunnelling accessible even on the free tier.
Realme's X3 SuperZoom packs an impressive set of specifications into a sub-£500 handset, with compromises made in all the right places. Just don't expect too much from the 60x zoom capability.

We continue to see huge strides in prolonged battery life on truly wireless earbuds and the competition is broader than Apple, Google, Jabra, and Samsung. RHA is known for high quality audio products and this latest model offers the longest battery life we've seen on truly wireless earbuds.

product name: Microsoft Surface Book 3 - 13.5" - Core i7 1065G7 - 32 GB RAM - 512 GB SSD - English
product description: When you part with over AU$4,400 you want the best, with the Surface Book 3, you're going to get it.
The 2020 XPS 15 has an excellent high-resolution UHD+ display and even slimmer bezels than its predecessor. Battery life could be better, but the XPS 15 still sets a high bar for 15-inch laptops.

The TCL 10 5G's specification, build quality, performance and battery life are all impressive given the price. However, it's shown up in some areas by its (4G) 10 Pro​ stablemate, while the OnePlus Nord offers even better value for money as a mid-range 5G phone.

Lenovo's ThinkPad X1 Carbon continues to evolve, and remains an excellent ultraportable laptop for business users. The only question marks surround the sizes of the screen bezels (too big) and the touchpad (too small).
The Kyvol Cybovac E31 a nice, low-profile, two-in one sweeping and mopping robot with an easy-to-connect app.

product name: ZAGG Auto-Fit keyboard and folio case
product description: Until this keyboard arrived, Android tablet owners were dependent on the tablet maker to build a keyboard just for their tablet. This universal keyboard case takes a unique approach to work for everyone.

product name: Cubot X30 review: good  all-round performance from a phone with an amazing camera
product description: The Cubot X30 is a nice, slim-line, non-rugged phone with a lot of features and a heck of a camera.
The Lifebook U7310 is a compact 13.3-inch ultraportable that's both lightweight and solidly built. Battery life is disappointing, but at least the battery is removable.
The Hobot 298 is an ingenious robot that will clean your office windows until they shine -- inside and out.
Getac's 7-inch ZX70 G2 gets CPU, RAM, storage, camera and other updates, while retaining the previous model's fully rugged industrial design.
The Ecovacs Deebot T8 robot vacuum works with optional modular accessories to enhance your robot cleaning experience

product name: HP EliteDesk 705 G5 Desktop Mini PC
product description: HP's EliteDesk 705 G5 is an affordable, configurable and space-saving option for running routine office software.

The Apple Watch is arguably the best smartwatch available today and improvements like a very bright always-on display and new colors are nice to see. The health software needs work as sleep and blood oxygen tracking are not as well done as others.
Long known for its gaming systems, MSI continues its quest to join the workplace with a stylish, powerful laptop well suited for content creator pros.
The premium Android tablet from Dell is thinner than the iPad Air 2 and lighter than the iPad mini.
The Auzai HD LED monitor is a low cost, light bright 21.5-inch monitor with excellent color display.

The Roborock S4 Max is a superb really powerful single-function robot that is perfect for vacuuming large swathes of carpet, or mixed flooring areas with zone control and no-go area configuration through its easy-to-use app.

A screen with a super-fast 144Hz refresh rate, the top-end Snapdragon 865 chipset and a high-resolution 108MP main camera catch the eye. But check the lengthy list of what's not on offer with this large 6.67-inch smartphone.
The ADAPT 660 offers excellent sound reproduction and easy on-device controls, although the Micro-USB charge cable and somewhat flimsy carry case are disappointing.
The OnePlus 8T is a solid mid-range 5G smartphone with two standout features: a sharp and vibrant 6.55-inch AMOLED screen with a fast 120Hz refresh rate; and 65W fast charging.
The new Teams integration from MindManager equips the web version for collaboration, but the desktop app retains more powerful features.
It's not cheap, but this small, ergonomic wireless mouse packs in plenty of useful functionality.

Samsung and OnePlus phones have always excelled at cellular reception, customized widgets, and user customization. With the iPhone 12, Apple now competes in more areas than just a friendly UI for the masses.
The Oukitel WP8 is an affordable rugged smartphone with a huge screen and great camera.
The smallest iPhone 12 of the lot, the Mini is just as capable and powerful as its bigger counterparts.

Amazfit has been releasing a host of new smartwatches and the latest two provide vivid AMOLED displays, attractive designs, and affordable prices while also offering a vast amount of health tracking technology. They are both successors to previous generation models and are well worth your consideration.
The Kyvol S31 robot vacuum automatically empties its on-board dustbin for anyone who finds the daily emptying of the dustbin a drag.
This battery-powered Bluetooth/USB speakerphone is nicely designed, with intuitive touch controls and the ability to charge a handset if necessary.

Today's modern smartphones are extremely capable and there aren't many functions setting them apart. Field workers, outdoor enthusiasts, and others spending time in the elements may want a rugged smartphone and that's where the latest model from Kyocera steps up to the plate.
If you need to work outdoors in challenging environments where water, dust and debris threaten the safety of your laptop, then the Enduro N3 should earn its keep.

Bluetooth wireless earbuds are very popular today with many new models launching with active-noise cancellation support. These headsets typically fall into the $200 range, but Monoprice checks all the features for just $100.

product name: Ecovacs Deebot N8 Pro+ robot vacuum
product description: The Ecovacs Deebot N8 Pro+ is a powerful robot vacuum that will avoid your carpet when in mopping mode and increase its vacuuming suction power when it detects carpet.
We are impressed with Lenovo's latest ultraportable ThinkPad, although the 13-inch screen won't suit every use case, and the paucity of ports and connectors may put some potential buyers off.
GMK's NucBox2 is a superb mini PC with a host of potential use cases at home or work.
Samsung's 6.5-inch Galaxy A52 5G offers a good set of features at an attractive price point, including a 120Hz Super-AMOLED screen, but only two of the four rear cameras really pull their weight.
The AGM M7 rugged phone will survive most accidents and is easy to use, and with its 3.5W speaker, you will never miss a call again.
ZTE will soon launch a new flagship in the US for $749. It sports high end specifications, triple rear 64MP cameras, 144Hz high refresh rate display, and more.
If you want a fully featured, multi-purpose robot vacuum with a good app, the 360 S10 should definitely be on your shortlist
Despite its impressive specifications, including a second screen at the back and 120x digital zoom, Xiaomi's new flagship doesn't beat the Mi 11 on value for money.
The 2021 update to CorelDRAW has a timely focus on collaboration and on simplifying complex workflows, and includes a powerful perspective drawing tool.

product name: Dreame Bot L10 Pro robot vacuum
product description: If you need a two-in-one mopping and sweeping robot with voice control, scheduling and object avoidance then take a look at the Dreame Bot L10 Pro.
The Bluetti AC200P is a perfect addition to your home or office to keep your appliances and tech devices going when the power goes out.
If you have a laptop that supports Thunderbolt 3, Plugable's Thunderbolt 3 Docking Station is a competent and unobtrusive solution for office- and home-based workers.
Despite its solid CPU, RAM and storage platform, the 2021 MateBook X Pro fails to address its awkward webcam arrangement and delivers less battery life than last year's model.

AfterShokz is known for its bone conduction technology that leaves your ears open to your surrounding environment. The OpenComm headset incorporates a boom mic for an optimal voice communication experience.

product name: Netgear Nighthawk RAXE500 Tri-Band Wi-Fi 6E Router
product description: Netgear adds support for the latest 6GHz Wi-Fi 6E standard to its flagship router, which supports throughput of up to 10.8Gbps and 'fast and reliable' connections for up to 60 devices.
The Bagotte BG800 is a nice-looking robot vacuum cleaner with a simple-to-use functional app, remote control, and boundary strip.
A great way of adding the latest high-speed interfaces to your PC or Mac.

The iMac is dead; long live the iMac. After ringing up reported sales of 6 million units, Apple has retired its famous teardrop-shaped consumer computer and replaced it with a visually striking device that has to be seen to be appreciated. The revised model's 15in. LCD screen hangs suspended by a stainless-steel articulated arm above a dome-shaped white base that looks like it was designed for a table lamp.

We love the firewall and anti-virus combo, but if all you want is a way to keep hackers at bay, Norton Internet Security 2002 costs too much. Get it if you need anti-virus protection too; otherwise, download the free ZoneAlarm firewall.
If your work involves running high-end workstation-class applications at different locations, this well-specified notebook is worth considering.
The Siri Remote may steal the show with Apple’s latest Apple TV 4K, but the entire setup deserves some praise.
VirusScan is not the best virus slayer on the street. Go for Norton instead and install a free firewall such as ZoneAlarm.
A simple and flexible way to add wireless networking to any PC.
Good value, but lacks dynamic routing and voice prompts.
Although it's not perfect, DynaPel's SteadyHand is an inexpensive and extremely useful addition to your digital video editing suite.

For those who must have leading-edge kit, this is the first Bluetooth printer we've seen. However, if you just want a printer and can live with wires, you can get the same print quality for less money.
If you need a little extra computing power, this 2.2GHz Pentium 4 system can certainly provide it -- but there's plenty of attractively priced competition.

Zoom has produced a great product that will suit most users, irrespective of connection type or mix of wired and wireless clients. The built-in print server is a bonus, but even without this it's a compelling package.
If appearances and capabilities are more important to you than the last few drops of performance, the VAIO PCV-RX1 is a desktop PC you should consider.

If you want a high-quality desktop replacement notebook that's ideally suited to video editing and other multimedia content creation applications, Sony's VAIO PCG-GRX516SP fits the bill - but be prepared to pay a premium price.

Toshiba has done a good job of designing a convertible Tablet PC, although it is heavier than some of the slate-style competition. The pen interface isn't perfect, but this is principally a software issue.

product name: Microsoft Wireless Optical Desktop for Bluetooth
product description: Despite some installation glitches and evidence of keyboard driver instability, the Wireless Optical Desktop for Bluetooth is a pleasure to use. Cable clutter is reduced and mobility significantly improved. It’s well worth considering as a replacement for a conventional keyboard and mouse combination, but does not yet provide reliable interoperability with other Bluetooth devices.
Red Hat remains a solid Linux contender, but Windows switchers or dual-booters should choose SuSE for its easier installation.

MindMap Professional 2 provides a rich environment for creating mind maps and other business drawings, along with tools for collaborative reviewing and annotation. Be prepared to spend some time learning it, though.

Companies with significant numbers of mobile workers would do well to look carefully at Dell’s GPRS solution. It may be expensive to set up, but all the hard work is done for you, and there are serious productivity gains to be had.

product name: NetGear DG814 DSL Modem Internet Gateway
product description: Home/small office networkers interested in a ‘wires-only’ ADSL connection should consider this well-featured and reasonably usable DSL modem/router/switch.

PC Immobiliser is a simple device that should increase the security of any PC or notebook, and make it less attractive to thieves. The use of iButtons to restrict access to anyone who doesn’t have the correct token works seamlessly once set up.
With its sharp appearance, ease of use and great price, Keynote sweeps the Mac presentation market. Definitely choose it in preference to PowerPoint for Mac.
Home and small business users requiring a well-designed mainstream notebook with excellent performance and reasonable battery life will like the desktop Pentium 4-based Inspiron 5100.
A well-designed, well-made and fully featured notebook, the Lifebook E2010's only real drawback is its rather high price.
Current Opera users should definitely upgrade. Everyone else: evaluate this browser using the ad-free download period.
Archos's handsome Ondio packs an ambitious feature set into a small package for a fair price.
This well-designed suite of PC utilities is the perfect solution if you're looking for a huge number of features at a low price.
A good choice if you must have an Internet-connected handheld today, but discerning buyers are advised to wait until there's more choice.
If you've got the space for it, the cp1160 is a good general-purpose printer for homes and small businesses.
This reasonably priced XGA LCD projector performs well and delivers good value for money.
The G4s are the fastest Macintoshes Apple has yet built. The 867MHz model offers good performance for a decent price, with a DVD-R/CD-RW SuperDrive in case you want to create your own DVDs.
Although cheaper satellite navigation systems are available, Compaq's handheld-based solution has much to recommend it.
With a cutting-edge processor and a high-resolution 14.1in. screen, the Inspiron 4100 is a straightforward two-spindle notebook that will appeal mainly to business users.
A fast, well-equipped and elegantly designed notebook that'll handle demanding applications with aplomb. But there are cheaper alternatives that perform as well or better.
This could be the product that kick-starts the Linux handheld market, but we'll have to wait and see.
If you've been waiting for a good reason to purchase Mac OS X, Office X is it. But if you're happy with both Office 2001 and OS 9, you won't find enough improvements to justify the upgrade price.
With its high price, bulk when docked and moderate performance, this is not the ultraportable system we'd expect from Sony.
This projector will work in almost any conditions and with almost any input, albeit at a price.
The Cineza could do with being a little brighter and a lot less expensive, but is eminently suited to its role as a home cinema projector.

But although there may be more choices to come, one thing you're sure to notice is that these new products are more similar than they are different, including their higher price tags (which start closer to £400 than £300).

The DVD100i is an excellent, speedy drive for backup or for authoring DVD movies that will work in newer players. However, it can't match a DVD-R drive for compatibility with older drives and players.

Compaq’s new iPAQ 3760 is a definite step up from the H3650. It has double the memory (32MB of ROM and 64MB of RAM), but still maintains all the popular features of its predecessor as well as its list price.
A worthwhile upgrade, if only for the reduction in power consumption and resulting need for less cooling technology.
A well-designed business-orientated notebook that delivers a good combination of performance and features for the price.
A flexible handheld/phone synchronisation solution, with potential appeal to business users.
If you already have version 6.0 and don't plan on experimenting with XP, you can skip this upgrade. Otherwise, buy it right away.
There's no better virus killer than Norton AntiVirus -- but unless you're moving to Windows XP, don't bother with this minor upgrade.
If cost is your primary consideration, there are cheaper notebooks available. However, Compaq's entry-level Evo N150c is a nicely designed, lightweight notebook with good battery life.
Thanks to version 10.1, OS X is now ready for the masses. If you already have OS X, upgrade now. OS 9 users should wait for Microsoft Office X to ship.
Toshiba has done a splendid job with the Tecra 9000, which delivers a comprehensive set of features (including wireless LAN) plus good battery life, all wrapped up in a well-designed package.
A good value mid-range PC that introduces Intel's 845 chipset and SDRAM to the Pentium 4 processor.
An excellent and inexpensive graphics and photo printer -- if you can overlook the flaws in its text-printing abilities.
A fair USB scanner at a modest price.
The Astra 6450 is slow despite its FireWire interface, and delivers only moderate quality transparency scans.
Although it's relatively expensive and missing one or two features, the Perfection 1640SU delivers high-quality scans.
The VAIO FX301 is attractively priced for a brand-name portable, and both well-specified and powerful. However, it still suffers from the battery life problems that undermined the FX201.
This is a top-class system for running multimedia applications and games -- and pretty much anything else you care to throw at it.
Palm's upgraded entry-level device breaks no new ground, but offers a good set of features at a reasonable price.
A good entry-level Palm OS handheld, although it breaks no new ground.

product name: Creative Labs Sound Blaster Audigy Platinum eX
product description: A state-of-the-art sound card that comes close to the flexibility and quality of dedicated studio equipment.
A good choice of Palm OS handheld for power users on a budget.
If you must have the current leading-edge in 3D graphics acceleration, this is it -- but be prepared to pay handsomely.
Business users requiring a fast WAP phone should consider the S45.

While retaining the iPAQ line's classic look, as well as its 206MHz StrongARM processor, the H3850 adds new hardware power with a Secure Digital (SD) card slot, a 16-bit colour reflective LCD screen, new voice-control software and 64MB of RAM.

Casio's Pocket PCs have always operated in the shadow of Compaq's iPAQs. But the new Cassiopeia E-200 is ready to bask in the handheld spotlight. Casio has improved its colour screen and added both a CompactFlash Type II slot and an SD card slot. The E-200 is a real contender.
With an enhanced display and increased battery life, the Jornada 560 series overcomes the major flaws of the previous 540 series, and strengthens its competitive position.
The V66 is superficially appealing, but closer inspection reveals serious drawbacks -- especially for business users.
PGP Personal Security will only be effective if you understand what it's doing and make it part of an overall security scheme -- just installing and running it won't provide a miracle cure.
Although the PCV-LX1 is a very desirable PC, it's not for the budget-limited or the 3D gamer.
An excellent high-speed network printer, but be prepared to add extra memory and paper trays.
If you require basic PC functionality in an unobtrusive form factor, the Micro PC could be for you.
The WA3050 is an excellent convergence device by today's standards, but it's not without its faults.
If you need to be able to print anywhere, anytime, this is worth a look - but there are, inevitably, serious limitations on functionality and performance.
The CMD-MZ5 is great if you already own modern Sony gear and want to carry your music around with you. However, there are better value phones available if telecommunications is your key requirement.
An excellent package if you want a phone with enhanced mobile communications. Compact and stylish, the Accompli overlaps with phone-equipped handhelds, against which it does not compare well.
Even if HeadCasting doesn't appeal, the Millennium G550 is still an excellent card for business users.
The ultimate 'road warrior' notebook gains Bluetooth and a faster processor.
The fastest notebook we've reviewed by some distance, Dell's Inspiron 8100 sets the performance benchmark for desktop replacement systems.
You must really want an all-in-one package for your Handspring device to justify spending nearly £300 (ex. VAT) on this add-on module.
This flexible scanner performs well and delivers good value for money.
All good all-rounder, sold at a competitive price. Recommended.
PowerPoint remains a top-quality presentation tool, but the changes in the 2002 version are merely incremental.
Combining the suite-wide enhancements with Word 2002's own feature improvements results in significant productivity gains for all types of user.
Quiet and easy to use, this scanner is fine so long as you don't require high-resolution scans.
Although Outlook has seen few improvements this time around, it forms a solid basis for tools within other Office applications.
Contains a good collection of new features aimed at both novices and professional database users.
An excellent starting point for your home network, so long as you don’t mind routing a cable or two.
This is an excellent product for the mobile presenter, but care should be taken when handling it.
A good choice for getting started with Linux, or for developing a small network of Linux clients.
Provides everything you need to share a broadband connection securely among several PCs - but beware the complex setup procedure.
Well worth considering if you're in a cramped office, or are working from home.
Is WAP the only feature that differentiates the Nokia 3330 and 3310? Find out in our review of the latest WAP phone from Nokia
Solid enough in terms of performance and battery life, but you'd expect a few more features for the price.
This dual-input 18.1in. LCD monitor should suit well-heeled professionals who want to maximise screen space efficiently.
The FX209K is a fast and well featured desktop replacement notebook, but it's too expensive.
This is a capable Pocket PC handheld with added GSM/GPRS functionality, but the mono screen already looks outdated.
Buy it, but don't upgrade unless you're unhappy with your current OCR package.
The adventurous design will turn heads, but the PCG-QR10's price tag looks too high for its target market.
Mobile professionals will like its portability, but the SR21K lacks power in its standard configuration.
If you need a desktop replacement notebook for the home or small office, the Presario 1800T makes an excellent choice -- if you can afford it.
A great workhorse colour printer for large networks.
The 'classic' VAIO notebook design continues to impress.
Buy a standard desktop anti-virus package instead.
It's not perfect, but it's the best Palm device yet.
This superbly-specified handheld will only disappoint those who require slimline dimensions or a colour display.
A good performer for the price, although the lack of T&L may put some buyers off.
Disappointing for a Sony device, despite the pleasing design. Wait for the colour version.
FrontPage offers a lot of functionality for Web developers who don't want to code their own HTML.
A simple, effective and relatively inexpensive way of connecting a small network to a broadband Internet connection.
If you want a top-quality desktop replacement notebook, and are prepared to pay for it, the FX109K is a good choice.
The ScanMaker 8700 work faster than parallel or USB scanners, but operator speed remains a key factor.

product name: Symantec Backup Exec Desktop Pro v4.5
product description: Superb backup software for individuals and small workgroups.
An excellent presentation solution for the mobile professional.
An excellent, if pricey, video conferencing solution, primarily aimed at business users within the corporate firewall.
A very fast PC, and much better value than any Pentium 4 system at the moment.
One of the smallest and lightest projectors you can buy.
The Visor Edge packages the functionality of the high-end Visor Platinum in an attractive slimline design.
The Inspiron 8000 1000UT is a true desktop replacement notebook, thanks to its 1GHz CPU and superb graphics subsystem.
A very capable printer for workgroups with high throughput requirements.
A great entry-level mobile communications tool.
A versatile monochrome printer for small workgroups.
A must-have product for gamers, once DirectX 8 support becomes widespread and the price comes down.
A useful service for both home and business users.
Its output quality is excellent, but the P-400's price and slow speed may put some buyers off.
A versatile workstation aimed at multimedia content creators.
Even on a 9.6Kbit/s GSM network, OmniSky delivers a usable service that's streets ahead of any WAP phone.
A superb desktop replacement notebook.
A great choice for the business user requiring power and a modicum of portability.
Although not without its faults, the Digital Wallet is a product that many digital photographers will have been waiting for.
A well-priced 17in. monitor, with image-enhancing LightFrame technology as an added bonus.
A versatile connectivity solution for Handspring Visor users.
Worth considering if you don't need a colour display, although the Deluxe offers better value for money.
A good transportable platform for multimedia content creation - if you can afford it.
The most usable and powerful 'mind-map' creation software on the market.
The best visual Web design program available.
OKI's C7200dn is an affordable network colour printer that delivers excellent output speed thanks to its efficient use of single-pass LED printing technology.
A compact portable printer capable of very high-quality -- if small and expensive -- prints.
A good first cut at a Pentium 4 system for business use, even if the CPU has yet to prove its worth.
It's not the cheapest, but this is certainly the best VoIP service we've tested to date.

The Internet is a two-way street: The more time you spend gathering information online, the more you need to make sure that others aren't doing the same to you. Symantec addresses this concern with Norton Internet Security 2000 (NIS 2000).
Problematical setup and operation left us unimpressed.
A superbly functional utility for anyone who configures and maintains hard disk subsystems.
Review - Norton Personal Firewall 2000 2.0
Despite its 933MHz desktop CPU, the MediaBook Extreme fails to outshine current 750MHz SpeedStep notebooks.
A worthy addition to the low end of the Palm range.
Version 5 is a much more user-friendly program than its predecessors, although learning it is still not a trivial task.
It's certainly portable, but it's expensive and can't print on plain paper.
Good value if you want a reasonably portable all-in-one notebook for running mainstream rather than demanding applications.
An impressive attempt to establish colour inkjet printing in corporate workgroups.
Considering the price, the Matrix D750 Pro offers an excellent blend of features and performance. A fine entry-level PC.
A marvel of miniaturisation with better battery life than previous C1 models, although the jury remains out on the performance of the Crusoe processor.
A well-designed compact PC that comes with a useful online solutions centre for small and medium-sized businesses.
The Dimension 8100 has plenty of 3D graphics speed for gamers, but existing designs run mainstream applications faster.
This is a powerful workstation, but designs based on existing CPUs deliver comparable performance with today's software.
A well-designed and attractively priced compact PC.
The best-value colour handheld on the market.

With NetObjects authoring Server Suite 2000, Net Objects Inc. has given Web site administrators a broader range of control over site content, expanding what had been a strong team development system into a potent set of tools for content management.
by Jim Rapoza, PC Week LabsMore than a year after the announcement of BizTalk, Microsoft Corp. has revealed little about concrete applicationsupport for the technology — until now.
Software by WebOS gives workers option of accessing lightweight productivity applications over the Internet.
Version 3.0 of Yahoo!'s Messenger(Download) instant-messaging client includes new features like voice chat, online conversations, and better integration between Messenger and Yahoo!
Great graphics, a low price and HP's reputation make this a good choice for home users. Better text quality and lower ink costs would help, though.
Great speed, great graphics -- shame that Epson's Stylus C80 falls down on something as essential as printing plain-black text.
The Sigma Si is a good-value all-in-one notebook that's worth considering, so long as you don't need to use it for long away from mains power.
3Com's Home Wireless Gateway is a usable and affordable device for directing data into and out of your network. It also acts as a firewall to help keep hackers at bay.

Sony Ericsson has loaded the P800 with a myriad functions, yet somehow manages to integrate them successfully. The result is a hugely powerful device that will satisfy all but the most demanding users.

If you have Bluetooth-enabled equipment and you'd like to connect it to your PC, this is a straightforward and affordable way of doing it. A PC Card adapter may suit notebook users better, but it'll be more expensive.
If you're on a budget, NEC's MobilePro 200E might encourage you to stretch it as far as possible: you'll get design and portability that's often lacking at the lower end of the market.
Apple's free Mac OS X-only browser is worth considering if you're sick of Internet Explorer for Mac, but -- in beta at least -- it's hardly a compelling offering.
ViaVoice 10.0's improved speech engine makes it a mandatory upgrade for current customers, and the best choice for anyone new to speech recognition.
The Versa C150 is surprisingly stylish for a corporate desktop replacement system -- not to mention fast, pleasant to use and long on battery life.

The StorageWorks AiO600 will make your job easy if you need to migrate an Exchange or SQL Server as the wizards and ASM are very user friendly. If, however, you do not need all this then perhaps a NAS box with less bells and whistles may be a better bet.
iBurst is a superb wireless broadband solution that's highly useful for the mobile business user, but users who don't require portability will likely find its price to be a deal breaker.

Nokia brings ease-of-use to 3G with the introduction of the 6280. Boasting a 2-megapixel camera, an MP3 player, video camera, and an updated interface, Nokia paves the way for those cautious of third-generation phones.
Acer's Windows Mobile 5.0-based n311 has a large VGA-resolution screen, integrated Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, and plenty of memory. Infrared fans will be disappointed, though.
Fujitsu's 13.3in. Lifebook S760 is well built, apart from a rather flexible lid, and has enough functionality to satisfy the needs of most business travellers.
Samsung needed a compelling device to bounce back from the Galaxy Note 7 fiasco and the Galaxy S8 is sure to appeal.
The Google Mini takes much of the hassle out of deploying a search engine, doesn’t cost the earth and, best of all, it’s from Google: a winning combination.
Clip this 120g pico-projector onto the back of a Moto Z handset, and you can project smartphone content onto a screen up to 70 inches in size.

This major update of Dell's Compellent storage technology adds an additional tier of low-cost MLC SSD drives. Also in the mix is a new high-density HDD enclosure, plus deduplication and compression for the Fluid File system clustering option.
This isn't the cheapest connected camera on the market, but Netgear's Arlo Pro packs a good range of features from a siren to a rechargeable battery.
These are well-made wireless earbuds with active noise cancellation and a feature-rich companion app, but some may find them a tight fit.
It's no ultraportable, but if you need a laptop that can deliver genuine workstation-class graphics performance both on the desktop and on the road, then Dell's Precision 5750 is hard to beat.
This a competent budget 5G phone, but there are plenty of similarly-priced alternatives, and the OnePlus Nord, with its AMOLED screen, faster processor and 8GB of RAM, doesn't cost a lot more.

Since I am not a professional runner and have no coach to monitor my form, technique, training plan, or other parameter, I rely on technology to help me out. The NURVV Run insoles provide another layer of data so in combination with GPS sports watches I get a complete picture of my running experience.
